name: Tallahassee Museum
address: 3945 Museum Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32310, USA
reviews: have been here a couple of times when visiting Tallahassee and I really enjoyed it both times.  It is not what you think of as a traditional MUSEUM.  It is very much an outdoor kind of place.  You Can learn a lot about Florida history and nature and see pretty plants and animals.

This is a great place for everyone- kids, teens, dates, seniors, families. Beautifully located among vibrant scenery, each exhibit gives a taste of what is around us in the Gulf South. Their birthday parties are wonderful and they think of everything from start to finish; I could not be more appreciative and impressed with ours. When we have out of town visitors, this is one of the first places we take them. Becoming a member was a great idea for our family.

Best decision was to get an annual pass. My toddler loves this place and I can bring family and friends for an easy day outside. There's lots of canopy to shade the entire trail and park. 
Highly recommend the zip lining. Best time to go is when they open as it's cool outside and the animals are active. Otherwise the animals hide in the shade or burrows.
Love this place. Perfect for families. My daughter loves to come and see the animals and play on the playground. I myself want to try the tree to tree adventure.
Had a GREAT time here! The staff was awesome and we had a ton of fun zip lining. We will definitely be back!

name: Cascades Park
address: 1001 S Gadsden St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Would have gotten 5 stars but as a person from out town it was hard finding the place. But once I did and found parking.  Seats were comfortable everyone was so nice. The bathrooms were pretty clean too

I went there one night around 10:00 or 11:00pm to walk the park with my husband , it was very nice other people working out and walking their dogs. Some people actually stopped and took pictures of my husband and I which I thought that was amazing. Very nice will go back again.

This is such a nice Park. It's very pleasant to walk here, go on a stroll, or ride those scooters. There's a few places to hammock and more to set up for a picnic. 
They have an amphitheater, splash pad (with restrooms right next to it), and a small kickball zone near Monroe Street.
There's also a restaurant that's not too bad and a great coffee shop below.
This is a nice place to bring your dog or throw a frisbee.
It's a big open park where lots of activities can happen and yet not feel overcrowded. 

Now.. There is a small spot for kids to play (sandpit, one slide) but that's about it. The real attraction for kids is the splash pad.

Unfortunately the city decided to build pretty much on top of this beautiful park and has disrupted the open view on one major side of the park. Time will tell how that changes everything.

I personally like this park a lot. It's clean and very beautiful. The walk-ways are long and wide and it's the perfect place to unwind with friends. It is missing some shading but I like that. It feels very open and after being trapped in classrooms and libraries and in front of bedroom desks, it's pretty nice to go there and be free. It does need a light on the north eastern side of the park. Where the big turn in the road is there's a huge bush that leads to the pond, it needs a lamp there and maybe an emergency booth. As a girl, it doesn't feel safe to walk that corner at night. I kinda just scuttle past it. Granted it's been sometime since I've last gone; perhaps that's been alleviated. Last criticism, for some reason the city of Tallahassee doesn't seem to like making exercise parks with actual exercising equipment. Perhaps that's something for them to consider. What's the point of those long walking & running paths if there aren't other exercises that can be done along it?

A delightful place to take a walk in the afternoon, or go for a run specially in the fall weather when it is cool and breezy. There’s a beautiful memorial to the forgotten war (The Korean War) which has great symbolism and beauty. There’s a great restaurant on the grounds with coffeehouse on the first floor in case you get hungry after taking in the wonderful sights.

name: Florida Historic Capitol Museum
address: 400 S Monroe St, Tallahassee, FL 32399, USA
reviews: This is a beautiful well kept historic site. I highly recommend it to anyone in the area, even if it is just in passing. We only had a couple of hours in town and we spent over an hour here. We could spend lots more time there and seen a lot more.
We came here for a visit, and brought the kids. It was a lot of fun. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars because we didn't have enough time to see everything.
Quite a hike to the top but a wonderful museum. Scavenger hunt for kids kept them engaged.
The Florida historic Capitol was an amazing experience I think God for it and I enjoyed myself God bless Gladys🙏🏿❤
Nice self guided tour of this historical building. Learned a lot about Florida history.

name: Mission San Luis
address: 2100 W Tennessee St, Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews: Definitely a recommended stop while visiting Florida's capital city. The museum contains a small collection of objects from the colonial era as well as an introduction to the life of the inhabitants of this land. Although most of the buildings were constructed based on hystorical records, the live representations and explanations by the staff are really helpful to better understand the context where the mission developed. The entrance is $5 per adult and it's open from Tuesday to Sunday. Recommended!
We found this to be a great place to spend the day with the kids. Open areas to run, we hiked through the woods, checked out really cool buildings, and learned many new things. Great time.

This wonderful museum, (More like a time-travel!) , Is perfect for everybody! They have workshops you can do , and the staff is so kind! Perfect for tourists, schools, and people who just want to get away from the noisy part of town (Which we locals here all understand the struggle about).

A beautiful place to learn about the Apalachee Indians tribe in the early 1700. Excellent restoration of the local tribe as well as the Spanish influence from the 1650 to 1700. Minimal admission (seniors are 3.00 each) it will take over 4 hours to really see all the exhibits. Really tells the history of a lost tribe.

Worthwhile for history buffs.  Beautiful grounds, and guides in all buildings, explaining what you were seeing.  Has a real blacksmith showing the lost art.  Also used as destination wedding venues and other.

name: Railroad Square Art District
address: 618 McDonnell Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32310, USA
reviews: It's so great to see an art district in Tallahassee.  While there aren't as many artists as I would like, there are shops and a restaurant to make wandering the area more interesting.  Go on first Friday when there are food trucks and everyone stays open late!

It never seems like all of the shops around are open? Currently under construction (in the opening where it happened to be my favorite, bummer) but the rest of the park is still amazing and fun and a great place to go on walks with friends, whether you're looking for something to do or not. There's several shops, art, a few small parks, places to park the scooters, and even a bike fixing station. Great walk, cool things.
Eclectic, creative, friendly and always evolving. Enjoyed walking through the square and meeting the artists. 612 Gallery is definitely a must see!

I enjoy the scenary of this area with the colors and the structure of the shops.  If you like crystal shops, herbal tea shops, art galleries, photography, and other activities then check out the Railroad Square Art District.
Small location filled with so many fun pinball and arcade machines. It's worth splurging on an all day pass. Leave and get a meal. Come back to game until they close.

name: Dorothy B. Oven Park
address: 3205 Thomasville Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: Went here over the holidays with my parents that came from Arizona.  Was nice evening out to look at the beautiful lights.  We will definitely be back next year.
Staff at the house and on the grounds are all so helpful. This place is always kept on beautiful shape. I plan to visit again. Christmas I would love to bring my son to see the lights set up.

Went to an arts and crafts Fall Festival 2 weeks ago with my daughter... and the event was really done nice. Of course... it's the Christmas lights that everyone goes to see, and it's always first class. Very nice place to visit. With Thomasville Road Baptist Church next door, parking is never an issue. Highly recommend.

Absolutely a must-see Christmas lights location! You can drive through or park and walk. Our family visits every year (usually more than once) and drive through then park and stroll for maximum experience.  If you need the holiday spirit, this is guaranteed. Also a nice little park year-round.

The city of Tallahassee did a great job this year. The display is the best I've seen in years. Its a family tradition to walk through and enjoy the sights and sounds. Great place for family photos too.

name: Goodwood Museum & Gardens
address: 1600 Miccosukee Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: Beautiful place to visit! Enjoyed the Rose Sale and half price membership
Very nicely preserved old house. Staff is very attentive and during the tour the explanations were superb.  You can walk the whole house. Uncommon in this type.of museums

One of the most charming venues in Tallahassee, Goodwood Museum and Gardens hosts beautiful landscape and unique architecture throughout the property. The staff are so sweet and helpful which is always appreciated when working at a wedding venue. We love when we get the opportunity to work at Goodwood as we always know we will have stunning photos of our couples on this gorgeous property.

A very Tallahassee historic venue.  The new air conditioned barn dinning area worked very well.  Food was great.  The grounds are well kept.  It's like being in the country, but only minutes from the Capitol. Handles parties up to two hundred persons.
Riders in the Sky put on an amazing 90+ min performance...so entertaining and talented. What a pleasure to catch them!

name: Museum of Florida History
address: 500 S Bronough St, Tallahassee, FL 32399, USA
reviews: There's so much to see about all aspects of Florida! The changing exhibits are great for seeing NEW things each time I come to visit, but even the permanent exhibits have me seeing new things when I look at them again. It's a great place to enjoy Florida's history!

This museum was a lot of fun!  They had lots to do here for both kids and adults. We learned a lot about the history of Florida. It’s a good stop off when you need to stretch your legs during a long road trip. The admission is free and they ask that you make a small donation. They had many different rooms and areas spanning over centuries.

What a great day. The museum is downtown right by the state capital. It covers history of the state from the early Spanish influence to past WW2. Also covers ALL aspects of the state. We spent over 3 hours here just enjoying the full info of the state. 2 city blocks away from the state capital so park and walk. 
FREE admission and parking.

We didn't research this visit much but saw it was recommended. Both our boys (10 and 12) enjoyed the museum with different parts being hits. Even grandma's attic was a hit with some fun moments. Way more to see than my photos, a ton of history from the early native America days, through Spanish occupation, statehood and World War II. The surf display was a nice bonus. You can easily use up 2+ hours here so I'm guessing it would range from 1-3 hours depending on your speed. Definitely worth a visit. The parking is $5, but free if you get a token from the front desk. Total cost, $0!

The museum was very informative and hits the major details of Florida's history up to World War II. As a former tour guide and history buff, I found the most enjoyable part chatting with their docent there, Paul, who was well versed in the history of Florida and very friendly. I came on a slow day so was able to hog a lion's share of Paul's time, but by far his expertise and excitement about history was what made this trip so enjoyable.

name: Tom Brown Park
address: 443-557 Easterwood Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32311, USA
reviews: Despite having never lived anywhere near Tallahassee, we first started coming to Tom Brown annually almost 20 years ago for mountain bike races.  Then I eventually left the sport and years passed.  Several years ago I made the first return to Tom Brown for model RC racing and it brought back many memories.  This past week I made another return to Tom Brown while in Tallahassee and it brought back even more memories.  The most amazing thing of the last 17 years is just how little the park has changed, while still making many improvements.  I'd love to return with a bike and ride the Greenway addition which previously did not exist years ago.
One of my favorite places to hike...I have been visiting since I was a child! So many great memories! The bathrooms were clean and park was well lit even into the evening!
BABY my service animal enjoys coming out here. ADA of 1990 🐾🐾🐾🐾🐾🐾🐾 a great place to have a family a great place to bring all generation together in a community.
We love tom brown park.  The dog park is awesome.  However, I do wish people would clean up after their pets. No one likes stepping in poo.
It's an absolutely amazing park, spacious and great for just about anything. We used it for a Pokemon Go outing!

name: J. R. Alford Greenway
address: 2500 Pedrick Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32317, USA
reviews: This trail is awesome. I walked the gravel trail while my 4-year old twin boys rode their balance bikes. I held my 1-year old daughter most of the time--some of the time she walked. Everyone had an awesome time! The views of the trees and fields are great. The trail was designed with big, rolling bumps that make it even more fun to go down the hills.

Nice place.  Lots of open spaces.  Plenty of woods.  Lakes for canoeing or kayaking.  Lots of trails.  Water fountains and water bowls are provided for dogs.  Dogs on leashes are fine.  Horses are allowed.
Love coming here! The greenway and its connecting to LaFayette Park is such a beauty, especially on warm days. In the spring, you'll see so much plant foliage too.
Get outside and enjoy this area with its many walking and biking trails.
This place was gorgeous and we took our family photos here! The perfect little getaway!!

name: Lichgate on High Road
address: 1401 High Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews: Beautiful park. Very peaceful. Lots of space. Very clean. It is a treasure in the middle of Tallahassee. People need to volunteer to help. Lots of historical significance. People need to respect what is there

By far, and without a doubt my favorite place in the world. Sounds like a hyperbole, however this point holds a lot of memories and deeper meanings to me, including the ashes on a dearly missed friend. I am fortunate enough to be able to donate some of my unfortunately 😭 abundant free time and. Albeit sparce lately I still feel blessed to be able to give back to such a beautiful place and to attempt at least, to keep it as radiant as it deserves to be. I hope to see anyone interested in visiting Tallahassee' hidden gem and if you are only a reader at this point and not a venturer to the 'gate; PLEASE GO, YOU'RE MISSING OUT RN 😁

This place is absolutely beautiful and serene.... The tree is so mesmerizing, there is a cottage at the back I am assuming someone lives there ...A bench on the side under shade where you can enjoy s nice picnic but be mindful to clean up after please!
Gorgeous. It really is like this hidden secret peaceful place. I absolutely loved it. I can't believe I had never been before!

Such a quite enchanted place under the trees. It's right by a busy road but its unnoticeable when in Lichgate. A beautiful garden and a few places to sit at. I would recommend bring a blanket to lay on by yourself or with others to enjoy the peace in the air. A good place to study too!

name: Tallahassee Automobile Museum
address: 6800 Mahan Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: This place is absolutely amazing!  There is everything here from all kinds of cars, especially my favorites, the muscle cars! There are knives, there are motorcycles, boats, pianos, there are dolls, toys, and a fabulous Batman collection! A great way to spend a whole day, there is that much to see!  And if you are in an RV, you can spend a night or 2 on the lawn while you see this whole museum. It has been wonderful, I highly recommend it!

This place was EPIC! We drove 3 and 1/2 hours from Tampa to get there. And it was worth every minute! They don't only have an extensive collection of cars but everything else you can think of (sewing machines, toy soldiers,  sports memorabilia, crash registers, old -1900s old- calculators, farm implements, MOTORCYCLES! knives, Barbies, ceramic dolls...the list goes on) highly recommend...

The inventory is extensive and eclectic. The cars are a delight. The mannequins need to be updated or removed. They take away from the amazing cars. I could do without the political assault when you walk through the front doors. If I  had been alone I would have turned around and walked out. Mr. DeVoe Moore has every right to put whatever he wants in his museum, but I have every right to save my money!

What a stunning display of all the new and classics!  I was impressed with the variety of vehicles right down to a wooden car before going outside to see the vintage ice cream truck. There are collections of dolls, cash registers, golf memorabilia, boat motors, and much more. Gorgeous, pristine paint on every car and something to see for everyone!  (side note: they do not give admission discounts for veterans on veterans day; just one flat rate for all) Thank you Tallahassee Auto Museum for sharing this wonderful array of collections.
My husband and I enjoyed more than just the wonderful collection of cars. There we Steinway pianos, antique guns, farm equipment, and so much more. I personally loved the boats and boat motors.

name: Florida State University Museum of Fine Arts
address: 530 W Call St, Tallahassee, FL 32306, USA
reviews: Not only does the museum have a great atmosphere and layout, their collection of artwork is amazing. They have the opportunity to host multiple collections a year and I suggest going even if you're not interested in art because it's a surreal feeling to walk through the museum.

Ok I was visiting a friend in Tallahassee on 02/03/2019. Google maps showed MOFA was closed on Sundays. I mailed the phone number pressed 1 as instructed and it stated Saturday & Sunday hours 1:00 P.M. to 4:00 P.M. We drove to the location and it's closed. 
Really?? A University where I assume University educated individuals work and they can't update the phone system or Google Maps. Sad.
Not a place I’d typically visit, but MoFA seems culturally relevant, accessible, and very nicely curated. It’s a place of considered intention not otherwise frequently found here in Tallahassee.

I love art, everything about it. And you can tell that the curators here have the passion for art as well. The exhibits are beautiful and there is always plently to look at. I love when they put up the student exhibitions, seeing their insane talent and passion for traditional art is inspiring and raw. I will return again, happily.
Great museum. Some exhibits are more to my liking than others. Always well done. Pleasant atmosphere.

name: Miccosukee Canopy Road Greenway
address: 5600 Miccosukee Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: 4 separate parking areas with bathrooms along the way. Lots of trail offshoots along the way. There are no slippery areas, even after the rain like some of the other local hiking trails. There's open fields and heavily wooded areas depending what you're looking for, wide main path is easy to follow or take the tighter paths to feel more secluded. There are picnic tables and cozy benches thoughtfully placed along the way and water fountains for humans and dogs. Lots of loops for you to decide how long or short you want your hike to be. It's a lovely place to run alone, walk your dog/kid, bike with a friend or even ride your horse. I've done them all out there and loved them all!
This hike with TSC was a challenge for me.2mi each way ,and some inclines.Woodsy trail.I had enjoyed the previous Miccosukee Hike  on another trail

Great place to walk for free in Tallahassee.  There is parking and toilets at both ends and also in the middle.  Nice wide paths that allows for walkers, joggers and even bikes and horses.  Make sure you keep your ears and eyes open for cyclists as they do sometimes go fast.

There is a six mile Trail Fram one parking lot to the other. Not counting all the small branches which has no signage. 

The place seems less crowded than Tom brown park. Every so often there will be a bench. Water fountains are only located at the parking lots.

 Be sure to wear a hat because the beginning of the trial is a wide-open plane, and later on you will be in miles and miles of woods.

Not too many interesting finds here such as animals or interesting plants but overall this is a great trail for hiking and cycling.
Good place for a hike. Either a long one or short. Walk through the woods and clearing. Found black berries. Water tower, even a cementary.  benches to take a break.cool spot to just walk.

name: Tallahassee-St. Marks Historic Railroad State Trail
address: Tallahassee, FL 32305, USA
reviews:
It’s a nice park with a great track/ sidewalk. Has bathrooms that are generally pretty clean. Right next to a couple stores. 
One of the downfalls to me was the amount of traffic that goes by constantly. But it’s a nice spot to rest up or stretch out
A wonderful trail for biking or skateboarding. The pavement is smooth and there aren't any  large hills since this trail used to be a railroad. Make sure to bring your own water.
Looks really cool... where do you park?!? Help lol
Very great walks, bikes, or a jog. It's pretty long and you don't even feel the distance of this thing.

Fantastic trail suitable for road bikes. Smooth path and well maintained, but could do with some more water fountains along the way. From the car park to the end is 25km, so 50km for the return , which is pretty good. A few stores at the end to refuel and done lovely views.

name: Elinor Klapp-Phipps Park
address: 4000 N Meridian Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32312, USA
reviews: Red Hills Horse Trials is simply the best equestrian event for horse lovers to watch or to participate in as a volunteer. The community comes together to put on a fluid, well run event that is world class. Look for it every March. Hats off to the Phipps family for the foresight of donating the land for this wonderful park and especially for this event. Thank you.

I had a great time on the mountain biking trails. They were not extremely difficult but they definitely weren't easy. There were many ponds and streams and one of the ponds had turtles in it. Overall great scenery and would recommend you go on a cool and cloudy day be cause your going to sweat. A lot.

Very nice park when the mosquitoes are dead in the winter. Bring bug spray if you go any other time.

The recreation fields always seem well maintained, but I usually go on the trails. There are quite a few downed trees from the past years hurricanes, but you can walk under or around them.

The trail itself is very pretty, with a lot of streams and one very neat waterfall. Not very populated, but the bike trail has people riding usually. 

There are often people walking dogs without leashes here. Please leash your dogs, you can't control them when they are allowed to roam free, and it's dangerous for everyone. City leash laws apply here.

Municipal soccer complex with many fields and not enough parking or family seating. Some fields have bleachers but most do not. The grass is in good shape and there are a couple of AstroTurf fields as well. There is a concession stand which has a good variety of food for cheap (breakfast, lunch, and snacks), but often long lines and questionable hygiene. The bathrooms are plentiful and clean and located in the center of the very large complex. 
Bring a chair or a picnic blanket to sit on (and maybe a picnic) and prepare to cheer your kid's team on to victory! 
There's no real shade, so in the summer consider a tailgate tent.
Note: arrive early for best parking, prepare to wait in traffic to leave the complex, and this location is not handicapped accessible.

The park offers a variety of trails including wooded, semi-wooded and wide trails and fields. I often see people hiking,  riding horses, and bikes in the park.
Highly recommend!

name: Knott House Museum
address: 301 E Park Ave, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Lovely spot, though it is small the poetry is cute. The guides are knowledgeable and good with groups.

Just a beautiful example of PRE statehood architecture of a home build by a free black carpenter as a wedding gift for a white owner. Florida was awarded statehood after this house was built and the Knott family kept the original furnishings and wall paper (in the main hall only) when they gave the entire house to the government. 
Picture a home as a time capsule from 1928 to 1941! The outdoor kitchen and bath from the original 1843 home has been moved inside then left alone. Mrs. Knott did a great job decorating the house and even wrote poetry for many pieces of furniture. She was very active in prohibition and sufferage.Mr. Knott was in the government accounting. FREE admission but bring a good donation. It is worth the 2 plus hour guided tour.
Excellent tour. Holley was knowledgeable  and patiently answered all our questions. The house was well preserved as was the contents.
Wonderful place to learn about American history.
Had a wonderful tour here recently..our guide was very well versed,and made our visit so enjoyable.

name: Florida State Capitol
address: 400 S Monroe St, Tallahassee, FL 32399, USA
reviews:
Best part of this was the museum. Lots of history to read about and nice and clean facility. Spent around an hour here since we just stopped by on a Sunday when they have restricted hours.
There are no clear signs to park but right across on the US 27 is a small parking lot to park for free.
This place is a great place to go to encourage legislatures to be better people. To let them know they don't have to be corporatist to win elections.

I liked both old and new capitol building. You can learn a lot of history in the old capitol and in the new one if you go up to the 22nd floor you can see the whole view of the city. Everything is free so why not

I now understand why this resort has a good review! It is so wow and it was a very nice experience of all!  Spacious for a family of four. The complimentary pickup and drop off was on time ( thank goodness -), it’s much appreciated esp for first-timers in here.
Good experience here. Guide, can’t remember his name was fantastic though. Have a good run down and left a great impression.

name: The Mansion Escape Room
address: 6497 Apalachee Pkwy, Tallahassee, FL 32311, USA
reviews: A lot of fun for our first escape room experience. The Chef Olivieri room was challenging and well decorated. Just wish we'd known that one particular set of props was not working/had nothing to do with the clues.  Nevertheless, my son loved it, and is already making plans to do an escape room every couple of months.

We did The Hidden Temple for a children's birthday earlier in the day and it was so much fun we came back that evening just the two of us.

My fiancee and I did the Chef Olivieri's Rescue as a duo and we had the absolute best time!

Nate was a consummate professional. He really knocked it out of the park with our experience today.

I seriously cannot wait to come back.
So much fun. I had a great time with my family and it really makes you think. We will come back.

We had a great time! The owner was very nice and worked with us in choosing a room. All of the staff was very friendly. The room we did was very well done and we had so much fun even though we did not escape! I would go back in a heartbeat!

I can't say enough great things about the mansion! The staff was extremely friendly, veryyy helpful especially because we were first timers, and overall made the experience that much more enjoyable. The actual room we were in was so much fun, the clues were clever, some of the features you use to solve from the clues are really unique and pretty high tech. Definitely am planning to come back and do the other rooms!! Overall excellent experience and would recommend to anyone!!!

name: Lake Jackson Mounds State Park
address: 3600 Indian Mound Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Greta place with lots of history to explore. The trails are easy for and the old mill ruins are quite interesting. A bit soggy when it has been raining so wear good shoes, especially if you are going back to the mound at the far end of the park.

Every first Sunday of the month, in the afternoon, there is a lovely group of people who get together and have a drum circle. They let me and my friend join in on the jam session. So much fun 😁🕺🏻would be a nice place for meditation or picnic

Today we hiked the entire Lake Jackson Mounds Archaeological State Park with around 3.5 miles of trails. Informative displays and several picnic tables are offered including bathrooms. Photographed is the tallest mound which stands 36 feet high with a base that measures 278 feet by 312 feet. It was built by Native Americans belonging to the Fort Walton Culture.

A very interesting hidden spot in Tallahassee. There isn't much here to keep your attention though. It would be nice to have more information on the Native Americans who lived here. Maybe better displays, a mock hut to show what their daily lives were like, etc. So much history here that isn't really represented

Off the Beaten Path but well worth the drive is this serene park that offers Earthen/Ceremonial/Burial Mounds from the Fort Walton Culture,  Florida largest known that dates to AD 1100-1500.  Colonel Robt. Butler's Plantation 1820c, mill dam & irrigation system can also be viewed from the nature trail.  Clean Restroom, ample parking, small fee, picnic tables, Pavilion, Interpretation Panels & Signs.  Visited in monsoon seasons so the grass, weeds etc. where overgrown, and there were some down branches from the hardwood trees.  Being pressed 4 time, only a few pictures and a short history lesson.

name: Alfred B. Maclay Gardens State Park
address: 3540 Thomasville Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32309, USA
reviews: I highly recommend this place if you're looking to visit Tallahassee. The scenery is beautiful and is in bloom mainly from January to April, although some of the plants bloom year round. There is a lot more to see than I was expecting. Outside of the garden area is the rest of the park that includes an area to launch boats onto the lake, they even have rentals if you don't bring your own, and quite a few trails to go and explore.

Breathtaking Garden, great and caring staff. This state park should be on your list of places to visit. Ranger Blair goes above and beyond for the job. Also be sure to check out the small classes that they hold! We just attended a painting class (only once a year!) and came home with beautiful work, we had a great time and we are so excited for our next class!

A beautiful floral park with walking paths and a maintained "hunting lodge" purchased in the 1930's. All original furnishings show the post revival from Southern plantation to Northern owned retreat. Mr. Maclay used his financial strength from the New York ice business to buy and expand this hunting grounds to a beautiful flower park. Now run by the state of Florida with a very low entrance fee to see the well maintained legacy he started.

It is a beautiful State Park. There is swimming in season  boating, lovely trails in the gardens with lots of pretty flowers and trees. There was a concert going on by the garden so parking was full, but we were able to park up by the lake and they had a tram that we could take down to the Garden so we didn't have to walk all that way. Very well maintained and friendly staff.

Well maintained and beautiful, even on a chilly day!   Great picture opportunities everywhere and lots of room to explore with nice paths.  Helpful guide in the house with answers to all our questions,  and lots of hidden little bits of fascination all around

name: Sky Zone Trampoline Park
address: 1925 N Monroe St Suite 109, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: My husband and I put a deposit down for our kids birthday party. The day of the party we showed up to notes on the door saying they were closed due to an maintenance issue. I just wished they would have called us and told us, instead we got our 1 and 2 year old excited thinking they were having a jumping party. No one has responded to my emails for a refund which we deserve. My family just want our money back please!
Fun place! Kids and adults had a blast. Food and drink options also available.
This place is better for younger children 15 and under.
Had a blast jumping here!  Foam pit basket ball and large trampoline space.  Staff was professional and welcoming.  Would come back here

My son had his 5th birthday here yesterday. Best experience! The staff was friendly and professional. Our personal hostess, Andrea, was amazing!! The kids had so much fun with all the different activities provided. I did not have to stress about a thing! Highly recommend!! We also plan on doing a parent night out soon! 😊👍  👍

name: Capital Cascades Trail Park
address: Famu Way, Tallahassee, FL 32310, USA
reviews: Love this area. The only thing I would say is it needs some shade where the kids play. It was literally so hot my child played for maybe five minutes and was ready to go.

This place is great! I know it's for little kids but I swear, college students go to it more than they do. It is so much fun to scooter around in that area. Or actually monkey around in the park. I'm a bit sad to see them building pretty close to there. There's likely going to be more traffic to get to there and all the parking spaces will be taken by guests visiting it because in that area, the contractors and city officials do not like to add free parking for the tenants and their guests. If this is another Stadium Centre then parking at the park will be a lot closer than parking near the tracks.
Very neat... A little advanced for small kids, unique play equipment
Me and the children just love this trail. Its a trail we can walk anytime. We prefer the night time better. The colorful lights are nice to see and make great backgrounds for pictures.

This is a beautiful, well maintained park-but it needs some kind of shade. The grass is plastic, so in the blazing sun, it feels like death. We had to leave our shoes on or risk third degree burns. Other than that it's lovely.

name: Florida's Governor's Mansion
address: 700 N Adams St, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Great tour of the mansion, I would recommend it to anyone who's interested in the history behind it.
Lovely setting and such great staff.
Only on the outside. Took a few pics. Very peaceful

It is so nice to actually, attend, watch, have access to our government in action. Learning the history and having a first hand sense of what really goes on, as opposed to getting information on issues from the various filters of opinion pressed upon us by the different media outlets, is very refreshing!!

We spent time with so many impressive, dedicated, passionate individuals.... Our households belief in our form of government has been strengthened. It's not simple, smooth or easy.
Had good time with friends after meeting with governor.

name: Fun Station
address: 2821 Sharer Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32312, USA
reviews: This place was okay.  My son did have fun here but it is a little run down.  Particularly outside.  The putt putt course was very dirty which made it hard to play on.  Of course, my son is young so he didn’t care and still had fun but I thought if I’m paying to play and drove an hour to get there, it should definitely be more playable.  We have played putt putt at a lot of different places and this was the dirtiest course we have ever played on.  Inside was okay, they obviously pay a lot better attention to the inside than out.  All and all, we still had fun so I would recommend but giving a heads up on what to expect.

Been here multiple times over the 22 years I've lived here and I think it has both devolved and improved in some ways.  Took my kids to get them out of the house during break and it was a decent deal for what we got to do. The guys working there were very nice and accommodating.  Still think they need more actual arcade games and less skill cranes/redemption games.

Lots of big games like large over sized arcade games. They have refreshes their selection of games too. The go carts are ok but don't expect too much out of the mini golf. It seems as though fun station is pulling out of the slump it was in several years ago.
It was fun.. We had age ranges from adults Down to 2 yrs of age and everyone enjoyed themselves. Only got 3 states due to cosmetics. The place really needs a scrubbing and some paint

Fun Station is a good afternoon distraction, it could be filled out a bit. The attractions are decent. I particularly enjoyed the large laser tag arena with multiple levels and the go-karts were great. I think that the arcade could be filled out a bit. Over the last decade, arcade owners found that ticket games can be lucrative because they encouraged replay value, but the games themselves are hollow and lack depth. Fun Station falls into this trap. Maybe a balance of pinball and old-school arcade classics would encourage us dads to bring our younger ones in more often.

name: Lake Ella Park
address: S Lake Ella Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Every mom needs a break, so for us dad's, this is a great (free) place to spend an hour or two where you can enjoy yourself, and the kids will have a ball... As long as you have bread... There are a few bench swings, and you can relax and read stories, look out at the water, or even hand feed the ducks and Canadian geese.
One of Tallahassee's gems. Well cared for by the City and always beautiful. Easy .6 mile walk around the lake on a sidewalk. Lady and I love it there!!
Very well kept. We were pleased to see the homeless didn't bother anybody. Serene & peaceful.
Such a great place to relax. Nice scenery, lots of ducks and little shops near by to get a treat.

Very nice walk, beautiful landscape, lots of ducks and turtles to see. A few cute, quaint shops around the lake.  Picnic areas.  I didn't see a playground which would have been nice for the kids to play.

name: FSU Reservation
address: 3226 Flastacowo Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32310, USA
reviews: Great place for family and friends to hangout. You can also reserve your group meetings. It is beautiful out here. It is gated and well maintained. Lots of fun activities. A lot of green and even sand/beach volleyball. Lots of spots to have a picnic by the lake. Plenty of parking.

Paid entree for those that aren't students but you can't complain about the $3 for a nice lake experience. Rent a kayak or go stand up paddling and enjoy the Florida weather. It's filled with students but since no alcohol is allowed they are respectful and not rowdy. I came alone and had a relaxing few hours before heading on my way.
Never super busy, $3 for adults to get in and $1 for kids 6 and up. Can rent kayaks or canoes for $5. Just an awesome place.

Great place to have fun
Rock climbing, kayaking, canoeing
Beautiful scenery
Amazing place to hangout for a picnic
Beautiful park with good outdoor actives like kayaking, rock climbing, volleyball, etc. And best of all, it's free for FSU students!

name: Lafayette Heritage Trail Park
address: 4900 Heritage Park Blvd, Tallahassee, FL 32311, USA
reviews: Really nice local park with good facilities. Easy access to fishing break walls and decent trails (hiking/biking and canoeing). The park is usually empty untill 11:00 most weekends and gets somewhat crowded after that. The trail around the center lake has many locations to rest/picnic if the main areas were reserved or are busy.
Just an absolutely gorgeous place to decompress. A beautiful covered bridge is the perfect place to view the lake and the train tracks. This connects with the trail that comes in from Tom Brown.
So picturesque. Lots of dog walkers and joggers.  Can't wait to go back with a picnic along the water.

This a wonderful trail for walking or biking. There are wide paths so you can easily walk beside someone and chat, the ground is firm enough to jog and the terrain is interesting enough for a good bike ride. What a great escape from the daily!

Beautiful scenery..Well kept trails. The cutest kids are where they can do arts and crafts. 
Just make sure to pick your feet up. Pretty big roots.

name: The Grove Museum
address: 902 N Monroe St, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Love the Grove!! It's a beautiful hidden gem on Monroe street. The staff members who work there are so knowledgeable of the house and the land. The tours are also quite detailed and pays tribute to all aspects of the people who've lived and worked in the home. I love how they always showcase the history of the house and land with various activities for the whole family throughout the year such as their monthly Backyard Discovery program and Nature Walks. I will definitely be coming back again and again.

Great little gem in the middle of Tallahassee, just north of downtown. The house is beautifully restored and full of local Florida history. Definitely a must see for museums. The gardens at the Grove are equally well kept and make for a peaceful walk.

Today was ideal for the Nature Walk at the Grove! I had previously taken the house tour,but the behind the scenes tour of the property was very interesting.Our tour guide Jon ,was fabulously knowlegable.Recommended!

Lovely and somewhat hidden gem in the middle of Tallahassee. The history of the house is impressive, loved the information panels, the "on-the-hour" tour was also nice. Very knowledgeable and friendly tour guide.

Absolutely stunning, another jewel 💎 of Florida history. The garden features tons of Magnolia Trees and lots of beautiful flowers. A must see if visiting Tallahassee. 

The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. I love that they've included a kids reading time as well. 

Enjoy my photos!!!

name: Tallahassee-St Marks Historic Railroad State Trail - North Trailhead
address: 5057 Woodville Hwy, Tallahassee, FL 32305, USA
reviews: Excellent parking location to start either a trail ride on the Munson Trails or head down the paved trail to St. Marks (nice and flat). Convenience store and fuel are just North of the trailhead. Publix is within 2 miles (west on Capital Circle by Crawfordville Road).
Fun twisting trail... Good workout for a pleasure (non-technical) rider.
I love St. Marks Trail!

Nice trail for running or biking. Not crowded. 
If you're biking, be aware of some people walk it with their earphones on and will not hear you if you're approaching them from behind and yelling :" bike from the left", they'd still be walking in the middle of the trail...
GREAT bike path. Paved, separate from road. Plenty of benches and bathroom stops. Mostly shaded.

name: Natural Bridge Battlefield Historic State Park
address: 7502 Natural Bridge Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32305, USA
reviews: Come during reenactments. Fun activities, good food, interesting people,  well organized itineraries, and awesome battle scenes.

Have only been here once before during a reenactment.  We decided to take a hike here in the winter and check out the area.  The monument is about the only piece of history you can see. It's all interesting but there is very little to do otherwise. Wish there was more signage to be able to take a hike around or follow a path. Everything is either fenced off or you're walking right on the road.

Nice little family friendly park. Would be nice is there was a few more activities to do, but all and all is a wonderful little park to escape to for some rest and relaxation. 
Love the historic remakes of the civil war and the trails that can be walked on.
A great addition to St Marks Lighthouse tour.  Very interesting Civil War battle field that memorialized the North and South.  Dont see that very often
This was the 155 anniversary.  Smaller than Oluste but very well done by the Florida State Parks.  Lots of reenactors and settlement

name: Riley House Museum
address: 419 E Jefferson St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: What a wonderful spot! We learned so much! The staff is so great and enthusiastic!!! We loved it! We will definitely recommend this museum to everyone that is visiting Tallahassee and wants to learn real history! Things that were never taught to us in school! I was glad to share this with my family! Keep up the good work!
Loved this small tour. Our guide was very knowledgeable and  informative about the black history of Tallahassee.

The Mr. Riley figure was life like. The history behind the land and Mr. Riley was very interesting. We were escorted by a young lady from the FAMU New Student Orientation team and she did an outstanding job in presenting the facts of the home and Mr. Riley.
Great Tallahassee historical landmark and legacy!
Loved it! Enjoy learning about history, especially local history.

name: Winthrop Park
address: 1601 Mitchell Ave, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Beautiful park with many activities for adults and children.  The park is very clean and is  conveniently located near midtown. There are soccer fields and picnic tables along with things  for kids to play on. It is well lit and patrolled frequently by law enforcement. Actually,it is not a bad place to meet someone met online. It is spacious and well maintained

It's fun, but once you do stuff nothing's there to do. There's even a baseball court if you like that kind of thing. And tennis and basketball. The playground has swings and all kinds of different things.

Nice place to bring the little ones, great little playground in the shade of old oak trees. Six tennis courts, baseball fields, handball and basketball courts. Also a large vacant area that is excellent for a pickup football game.
Nice park. Fun for all ages. Basketball, baseball and tennis. Playground for the little ones and the older kids.
I play Ultimate Frisbee every Saturday at Winthrop. Great group of people! Come join us, but be prepared to run! I am older than you, so stop your complaining. 🤪

name: Spring House - Frank Lloyd Wright
address: 3117 Okeeheepkee Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: So much fun meeting Byrd and having her share her life and stories growing up in the Usonian house built for her family. It is definitely worth touring this very uniquely designed Frank Lloyd Wright pod home, which is only one of two built. The home is in the process of restoration but elegant nonetheless. Byrd told us it will be restored to  its originally designed plans.  Visitors may photograph the exterior only.

Alcohol and cocaine had been a great part of my life for 24 years. It was amazing at the start as It would make me feel invincible  and make me fit right in but my SOLUTION became my PROBLEM as the years went on. Because of this place, feelings of Calmness/Happiness and Joyfulness come up as I am writing this.  Feels AMAZING NOT to be as physically,emotionally and spiritually broken anymore and it's a work in progress. Keeps getting better everyday.
Delighted to visit here.We had an informative talk outside by Pat ,and inside by Byrd,the  gorgeous daughter who grew up in this special place.Such a lovely view.Enjoyed the trail walk.
So cool to see FLW house in a neighborhood setting.  Hard to see from the road.  Wished we could have been there on tour day.

I have been volunteering at Spring House for about 2 years now and it has been one of greatest experiences in life.  Of course being able to hear wonderful stories about life and growing up in Spring House from Byrd makes it that much more amazing!  It is definitely worth working into you itinerary.

name: Lafayette Park
address: 501 Ingleside Ave, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Now I really love this park! Great children's playground, trails, tennis court, & baseball field. The playground is far enough from the road (& downhill) that I'm more at ease compared to other parks. It can get crowded depending the time of day because there is a daycare/school next door. My kids love having other kids to play with so it just depends what you want that day. Again it's not always crowded, so just be mindful of the school days & times.
Such a nice local park.  My daughter and granddaughter enjoy the trails and fitness items along the walk.  There is also pretty nature and birds in the trees.

The tennis courts are nice. There are 2.the playground is for all ages. There are 2 of those also. They have a cemented area for basketball which is nice. They have a softball field but the clay is hard. It's actually pretty nice though. The outfield has very plush grass. Good for Frisbee, corn hole, whatever you like to do in the grass.
It's okay.  The squirrels were cute!  Small but at least it's a place to get into nature. Beautiful huge magnolia!
Beautiful covered park with a nice walking/exercise trail. The arts center is located in the park and offers a bunch of arts classes.

name: San Luis Mission Park
address: 1313 San Luis Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews: Love this park. The lake floods and recedes very drastically, which is pretty to see. But, that usually exposes tons of trash. I wish people would not leave trash/animal droppings but the park itself is great and convenient to downtown. Plenty of trails with maps, a nice pedestrian bridge over the lake, great parking, etc.
Went here with a couple friends and enjoyed a walk and talk. I explored the bridge as I had never been here before. 😯☺️🌉 Later we went to the cat cafe and I really recommend that place. 😸😽

My friend had her son's birthday party here. It was 96° outside and it was the perfect park for this heat. The big trees provided great shade and the pavilion area was very well kept. I walked around to take in the sights and I loved it out here. Very nice park to relax in, hike, or have a party. I plan to go back and bike/hike the nature trails.
Great little park, looking forward to exploring it some more! Went there for the dog park and we all had a great time.
We always have fun. Great field trips. Awesome ppl working and volunteering (?) there.

name: Fred George Greenway Park
address: 4830 Fred George Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: My favorite park thus far in regards to trails. Before the kids playground area (which is unique and fun all on its own) there is a small parking area with some wonderful trails. It's usually quiet and has lots of different paths you can take. They're all very different looking from one another (one has a lake, a large field, dense forest, and lots of steep hills). It feels like you're discovering new paths and mini ecosystems everytime you go. It's also excellent for dog walking.
Its a great park.  Plenty of parking.  Ample covered picnic areas.  Huge trail and greenway.  Really pretty.  Grass could use some mowing tho

I think this place is great for our community. However I am not a fan of the round about walking path that zigzags across the roads with stop signs for people, and I'm thinking about the little kids. I would love to see more development in the future.
Ample amount of parking. Love the sidewalk encircling the park and beyond. You can walk your dog free from traffic.
Nice park for variety of activities and sports. Boys were able to get their football training in with the Coach.

name: SouthWood Golf Club
address: 3750 Grove Park Drive, Tallahassee, FL 32311, USA
reviews: Very well designed and fun course. Greens were good except no. 17 needed work. Fairways played well.
Great place and atmosphere
Cool golf course, very fast and receptive (spinning) greens, hilly, and nice range and setup. The food was delicious and the staff were really nice. Overall a great place to go for a fun golf course.
Sunday Brunch was wonderful. The presentation; service; care of the staff; and, quality of the food was spot on perfect. Highly.recommended.
Course looks great even on a wet and windy day.

name: Governor's Park
address: 700 N Blair Stone Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Awesome place to jog around. Plenty of open space and enough other people to not feel too creepy.
What's not to like! A great place to stretch your legs and walk your dog! Be careful when it's close to dark some shady people start to show up.
Be alert if walking alone, there are several "camps" throughout the trails, mostly near the train tracks. Never had any problems, but you never know.
Beautiful wide open space.  Some connecting trails too.  They connect to Tom Brown Park!
Great park! Pet owners need to pick up after their dogs more often though because there is way too much poop left behind. The park has beautiful sunsets. Love this once off the map park.

name: Meek-Eaton Black Archives Research Center and Museum
address: 445 Gamble St, Tallahassee, FL 32307, USA
reviews: A fabulous resource not known even to many native Tallahasseeans. This is a great resource in our area related to black life, achievements, struggles, and experiences. Well worth a visit by anyone, and certainly of use to any educator in the area. It is difficult to access because of lack of public parking, but that is often true of any resource on a university campus. But it's also free! Hard to complain.
So underutilized because there is no way to access because of a lack of public parking.  What a shame.
I love you it

name: A J Henry Park
address: A J Henry Park Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32309, USA
reviews: This is such a very nice little local park.  I like the trail in the woods and the boatdwalk/ pier over the lake.  There always seem to be LOTS of turtles hete which is nice to see.  They also have nice picnic areas and a nice kids playground
Small and simple playground. Has a boardwalk overlooking a pond and it's fun to feed the turtles from it. Has trails and a 'hidden' basketball hoop.
We had a lot of fun this evening! Playground, turtles, geese, eagles, trillium, and lots of other cool plants 💚
Very nice place. Small dock and covered picnic tables. Flying bugs in summer so have some spray.

My family has enjoyed AJ Henry since 1993. I spent a good amount of my childhood and teen years here. I miss how it used to look with the wooden playground structure, but the current one today seems to be enjoyed the kids. The nature trail is routinely maintained and well marked; it has a nice blend of not being too long or too short. Excellent for a runner like me who likes upward slopes, or if you prefer mostly flatland there is a loop around it. The creek at one part is a very lovely sight and can be fun to do some exploring around.  Sandwiched between Arbor Hills and and another neighborhood makes it a nice off the main road gem that's inhibited mostly by locals.

name: Smokey Hollow
address: 501-599 E Pensacola St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: The garden is nice. Bathroom was locked.
Gentrification is real.  For all those people who keep trying to convince me otherwise.  Check out this place!.
My mom grew up here. There is nothing left of the neighborhood. Nice monument though.
Finally a sense of place! Historical to boot!
Beautiful historic area attached to the cascade parks area

name: Wakulla Springs State Park
address: 465 Wakulla Park Dr, Wakulla Springs, FL 32327, USA
reviews: Take the guided boat ride. Our guide, Captain Paul was knowledgeable and great. Saw lots of wildlife including Gators and snakes and tons of birds. I chose not to swim but there were quite a few people jumping in to the spring. Looking forward to coming back at another time if year to see different flowers and wild life.

At $6 per car admission, it is a great way to spend a hot afternoon.

The "beach" area is great for little kids. There are also multiple platforms to hang out or even jump from. The swimming area is separate from the rest of the river, which is nice to keep the rest of the Springs from being damaged.

The hotel looks very cute from the outside. They also have boat tours, although I didn't check to see prices or other general information.

I can tell that this place gets really full during the summer. The proximity to Tallahassee and FSU probably means lots of college-aged people. Not necessarily a bad thing, but something to keep in mind if that's not your scene.
Very pretty and well thought out paths. Good mapping unlike the civil war park at the earthen bridge. Or whatever you call it. Pretty sure there was more trails but very poorly marked.
Old school casual luxury at affordable rates. Charm galore. Gracious staff. Immaculate housekeeping. History and nature everywhere. Why stay at a chain when you're 15 minutes from magic?

Love love this place!! There are lots of family friendly activities here!! From kicking back and taking the river boat tours to just walking the grounds or relaxing on the beach. This place offers a wide variety of activities for the whole family and also boosts a 5 star restaurant on site. Would definitely recommend visiting this place!!

name: Lake Talquin State Forest
address: Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews: Nice hike.  Please, please, please check the blazing of trees in the midsection of the central loop trail.  There's a gap of about 75 yards where Michael knocked down a lot of trees. I was lost, trying to get back to the trail head, for almost an hour. Kept the sun on my right and followed the stream beds and sounds of traffic.  But it was tense.  Park team, please let me know that you've received this message.  It was scary.  LATER: thanks for the call back, and for serving your team out to check
Great ride thru the woods.well taken of dirt roads! Great fishing on the river.only bad part is the walk back to the parking lot from fishing all day! It's up hill all the way
Best place to put your boat in and get lost on the water for the day. Or you can rent a cabin and stay for a while.
Good fishing trip wonderful time with family very fun day

Walked two trails that they have to offer as part of the Florida Trailwalker Program. Excellent park for trails and had a great time. If you enjoy hiking, check out the Trailwalker Program the Florida State Forest offers.

name: Old City Cemetery
address: 400 W Park Ave, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: A sample of Tallahassee's rich heritage. Great history repository too for locating both African and European. As well as Cracker lore.
Great self-guided walking tour. Takes about 45 minutes.
This is a great place to wander around! The old Florida history is fascinating. The only drawback is the metered parking.
Excellent historic place to hike and take photos.

BABY and I watching the sunset 
ADA of 1990

name: St. Mark's Lighthouse
address: Crawfordville, FL 32327, USA
reviews:
Fantastic birding.
The Rangers working the welcome center could NOT have been more helpful.
Allot at least half a day to take your time, pull off the road, and hike a bit.
In fact this looked like a good park for bicycles.

By visiting this beautiful wildlife refuge it brought back so many Wonderful childhood memories. As I was younger growing up in Tallahassee Florida we would love fishing with our Dad!! One of our familys favorite spots was St. Mark’s lighthouse just because it had freshwater on one side as well as the ocean salt water on the other. I remember spending countless hours my brother and I catching pin-fish that my dad would Cut  in half and use for his bait hoping to catch even bigger fish and sometimes even sharks!! Over the years my dad had caught thousands of fish from this location including an alligator gar, a hammerhead shark and a smaller great white shark. We would walk out into the ocean as far as we could go without having water over our heads and fish all day long until nighttime - having to run to shore as the tide quickly came up along with the moon!!! There are many different picnic areas around and several different wildlife viewing spots. There are the most beautiful colored birds and even very large birds - the largest birds I’ve ever seen. We’ve seen bobcats as well as huge hairy fire-red ants and even An entire army of migrating crabs. Years ago  there used to be tons of alligators everywhere lounging in the sun.. My mom even wants tripped over a gator that was laying across the path to our truck. It was so long , it stretched over the entire width of the whole path. I will never forget that time. Unfortunately due to the new gator hunting season,  I never see any alligators at all anymore.. it’s sad. Overall this is an amazing place!!
This is an absolutely gorgeous place to be. The lighthouse is spectacular! So much to see and experience at St. Marks. If I came here daily I still could not get enough. I love this place!

we went to see monarch butterfly festival and stopped by the light house which is 7 miles from the festival venue. we could see few monarch butterflies here. the place is good to spend some time. it was nice that they had free shuttle Van service from the parking. we liked the light house and the area surrounding it. it is definitely a must see if you go to St. Marks.
I loved this spot for viewing wildlife and exploring as much as any place I have ever gone! Bring Misquote repellent! This is a Bucket list spot for anyone that enjoys the outdoors.

name: DeSoto Site Historic State Park
address: 1001 Desoto Park Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: A bit off the beaten track,but worth a visit if you have an interest in history.
Where was the park, I drove in, parked, walk to the end of the gravel, it's another street. I did not see the statue or the park.
An atmosphere stepped in personal history
Definitely worth stopping in to check out the artifacts in this small musuem. The staff was great and knowledgeable!

One of most historic place at the town, the artifacts was amazing and this is a very informative place to bring your child over, plus the staff is friendly and knowledgeable enough to entertain questions.

name: Lake Talquin State Park
address: 14850 Jack Vause Landing Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32310, USA
reviews: An amazing place to spend the day. Not far from Tallahassee. The lake is very pretty and there are two decks for fishing or just relaxing. The lake is surrounded by trails which can be hiked in couple of hours. As fir the facility there is a restroom and a sitting area. There is a $3 fee to enter the park which can be wrapped in an envelope and dropped in a drop box near the entrance. Bring your food and water, because there's no vending machine inside the property.

This park is the best park in the state of Florida. Great fishing and beautiful bluffs along the gorgeous banks of Lake Talquin. Not to mention the 1.1 mile trail that wonders through the pristine woods bordering awesome ravines with the lake as a background. Don't miss it.

Beautiful park. Short boardwalk along the water.  Small fishing pier. Nice bathrooms, clean with soap and hand towels.  Huge pavilion and grill area that can be reserved.  There is a trail,  but we didn't venture - too hot, wet and  too many mosquitos!!!!
Great place to spend some quality time
Nice park good trails and nice docks to fish off of or just relax.

name: San Marcos de Apalache Historic State Park
address: 148 Old Fort Rd, St Marks, FL 32355, USA
reviews: Small but wonderful little park with trails and great museum. The museum is very wheelchair accessible. The trails are good for a motorized scooter. Not a long hike, but well worth the visit.

Such an important place in world history. I never knew. I've been educated now and I'm impressed and thankful. Great presentation. Helpful and informative Gentleman working there. Thanks, we'll be back.
Small but incredibly important site. Native American, Spanish, American, and Civil War history all played out at this confluence of the Wakulla and St.Marks rivers.
Awesome place to visit really historic
The employee Bonnie there was very helpful finding a campsite for the evening.

name: Wakulla River Park
address: City Park Ave, St Marks, FL 32355, USA
reviews: Very well kept playground, river access, grass for fetch 🙂
First time checking out the park.  For the size of the park descent parking.  Public bathrooms and canoe/kayak ramp available.  This is a low key relaxing place.

My kids love this park and its a good spit for daddy to go fishing and kids to play. You can also have small weddings there because they have covered tables and bathrooms. The playground needs the toddler gym fixed after the storm.
Quaint park with playground and event shelter. Great views of River and picturesque sunsets. Dock with kayak or paddle board launch. Nice!
Very simple pretty parks very clean in the bathroom

name: USDA Forest Service
address: 325 John Knox Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Very helpful with expertise in forestry
The young man was very helpful. The only problem was they weren't set up yet to process park pass. The office experience was still good.
I would do minus... Pencil pushers .

Great place for large meetings.  Held a company meeting here and it held a large group of us comfortably. The only problem was the AC unit when turned on became loud and you need a microphone to hear speaker. Staff was friendly and bathrooms were clean.
Most offices are upstairs.

name: St. Marks River Preserve State Park
address: 11950 Tram Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32311, USA
reviews: What a great trail. We really enjoyed hiking through the park. Nobody else around that day, very peaceful with lots of deer tracks on the trail.

Just the right amount of trails for an out and back day hike. Trails are sandy with most of it just plowed fire lines. It has the main trail with a few side loops for extra mileage. No bridge across the St. Marks River at the north side of the park, so unless there are drought conditions you can't cross without getting wet/muddy. You will likely be the only one hiking here!

Great hike or bike. About 3 miles one way.  There are bears. Both times I visited I saw a momma bear and two Cubs (June 2019). They ran away but they do love in that area. 
Also saw turkeys lots of deer and a few snakes and an owl and a small bird with an orange beek.

This park is on former timber property that includes the upper Saint Marks River and a contributing tributary - Gum Creek. The area hosts many planted pines but otherwise is a really nice piece of property. Parts of the trail go through swampy areas closer to the creek (Gum Creek) and other parts go through higher ground. There are bay trees and large stands of native bamboo. The trail is at times former timber roads and at other times recently plowed trails. The footing is mostly sandy, swampy/damp or rough from ploughing/clearing. It seems like it might be difficult to use some of the trails in more wet conditions. I only walked the Yellow Blaze and southerly part of the Blue Blaze

Great park for a bit of an adventure. Don't expect a gift shop, and wear ankle boots if possible. Lots of flooded areas and some creek and bog crossings on the yellow trail. Nonetheless this park is home to some beautiful scrub habitat, wetlands and teeming with birds, wildflowers and other creatures. Didn't see any bears unfortunately! In the summer I imagine heavy bug spray or even a face mosquito net is necessary.

name: Doak Campbell Stadium
address: 403 Stadium Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews: This is honestly my favorite place on campus. I come here to de-stress quite a bit despite not being a football fan. Love it.

This stadium is loaded with history, and you can tell as you walk around outside—or inside—it’s massive unique brick structure. Midday games are deadly with the heat, the WiFi leaves much to be desired, and you still (at the time of this review) can’t buy alcoholic drinks and bring them back to your seat... But the experience is unmatchable!
Only the best place in the world to catch a college football game.  FSU has done an incredible job with this beautiful stadium.

Home games are crazy when FSU is worth a dime. Lately the tailgating is mild and can't fill the seats. Champions club is cool if you can afford it, but seats between the 30 yard lines are the best to actually see what's happening.
Love this stadium. Huge stadium. Lots of food. Great tailgating and the pregame show is like no other. Fans are loyal and the atmosphere is awesome.

name: Apalachicola National Forest
address: FL-12, Sopchoppy, FL 32358, USA
reviews: The trails here are expansive. Get outside and enjoy some natural Florida.
When walking in the woods you must always carry I love Florida laws

I love it because there is some of the best fishing in the world and some of the creeks and River that anyone could ever day we do it all the time we go down and stay a week at a time or more and fish and it's not far from the beach so you can go to the beach st. George Island and it is a great place to go but I love that Apalachicola River it is one of the best places in the world and you can go to River Styx or Shepherd slow or go to Owl Creek and put in and fish I got two gardeners Landing or bloody Bluff all are great places to go fishing you will love it as much as we do I have been doing it all my life I'm originally from Apalachicola but I no longer live there but I go back as often as I can to the forest to fish and if you want to go into the national forest there is plenty of creeks and things where you can fish and catch plenty of fish out of them as my son and daughter-in-law just to have done they caught 30 and no time open what they call Tate's hell which they had a great day so I hope you all appreciate the update and that black color National Forest it is a wonderful place to come and visit and to camp or walk the trails or just fish so enjoy like we do thanks
Oh it was so serene and beautiful.  We had a wonderful picnic and really enjoyed our hike.
Peaceful spot to enjoy the nature of Northwest Florida.

name: Challenger Learning Center of Tallahassee
address: 200 S Duval St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: The best IMAX screen in town. Nice staff & a good selection of current movies & documentaries. They also have a planetarium with a nice selection of shows.
Fun place to visit. The Imax theater is a full Imax and is only $10 for 1st run movies.

Best imax experience in town, other theaters advertise a display that projects to imax resolution, but once you visit this place you will realize what a lie they sell you at such a cost.

The popcorn and treats here are far more reasonably priced than a chain movie theater.  I won't lie and say the seats are great, watching a two hour + movie in there will hurt your bum.  But I have only noticed while watching movies that edge three hours.  

They have kids programs here, a planetarium as well as other activities that are worth exploring if you are looking for things to do that won't kill the bank.
Love IMAX.   BABY ADA of 1990.  Service animal

My wife and I love to come here. We respect the fact that the Challenger learning center charges reasonable prices for Imax movies. We feel that other movie theaters do not usually live up to there $+13 price tag. We use this opportunity to support this public location. Relatively clean building with friendly employees.

name: Gulf Specimen Aquarium
address: 222 Clark Dr, Panacea, FL 32346, USA
reviews: Small but great value! Hands on opportunities. Nice staff. Affordable gifts. Only $10 for adults. We watched an octopus eat a fish. Very cool

1 of the coolest places in Florida I have seen. I love the old school interactive vibe. I cant wait to bring my family here. Super educational and the staff is wealth of knowledge. This place is a must see.

So much to see! Volunteers & staff know their sea critters & aquatic facts! Atmosphere is that of a semi-outdoor working lab, rather than an aquatic "petting zoo (which happens, too!)." Director Jack Rudloe, author of the memorable book, "The Living Dock at Panacea," often leads off group tours with a brief talk, and is available for questions and feedback. Take lots of pictures!  An updated version of his book is in the works, and soon to be available. I Love this place! Support it, please!!!
This was a great family outing for the day. A lot of the specimens were hands on. My nine year old granddaughter had a great time and I did too.
Recommend to place for everyone,  young & old alike! The highlight of my trip, so very, very, interesting. Took awesome videos & pictures!

name: Wakulla Beach
reviews: Great place to fish. You can drive all the way down to the beach and launch a small boat or kayak right into goose creek bay.  Good place to fish year round with lotsa creeks that hold fish through the winter when water temps drop and fish leave the flats. You can see dolphins way back in the creeks too at high tide. Speaking of tides, it helps to know them before you go, both times and levels. On negative lows the water gets REALLY low and if you’re not paying attention you can find yourself spending the next few hours stuck in the mud waiting for the water to come back in.
My favorite public beach access. It is so beautiful and relaxing, it's my reset.
Awesome place to see wildlife at the right time.
Quiet not a lot of people and great fishing
There's usually not too many people and the road to reach the beach is really and pretty! I don't like how brown the water is, but that's the color of most of the close by beaches!

name: Roadside Rusted Ford Trucks
address: Crawfordville, FL 32327, USA
reviews: This is a place I stop every time I'm in the panhandle. The lighting here is magical for taking photos!  I've been doing it for years. Even the cemetery is getting old now. May the rust in peace!
Beautiful place 💖 theres a lot of spiders and snakes so be careful, other than that it's very peaceful.
Awesome place to stop if you're into classic vehicle 😊
Cool spot to pull off and check out some old rusty vehicles.
May they rust in peace

name: Taylor House Museum of Historic Frenchtown
address: 442 W Georgia St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Police order outside says no trespassing...
This place is a must see! Lots of antiques and other gems in the house.
Not very interesting
Good place to visit some time

name: Letchworth-Love Mounds Archaeological State Park
address: 4500 Sunray Rd S , Monticello, FL 32344, Monticello, FL 32344, USA
reviews: Interesting little stop that we stumbled upon. Didn't go down the trail, but the mound was awesome. There is more to it than just one mound, but for some reason those pictures were not options for me to upload.

Tranquil, but do wish there was more explanation of area, such as the artifacts they found and better description of mounds.  Do wish they would cut rubbish away from big mound so that one can see it better I expected something more
A great place for a stroll or nature hike.
Peaceful, pleasant, and clean picnic park adjacent to the highest Native American mound in Florida. As a State park, a parking fee is required in exact change with a fine attached.
Great place to visit and learn about ancient peoples. There's a pavilion with picnic tables and interactive displays.

name: Sage Restaurant
address: 3534 Maclay Blvd S, Tallahassee, FL 32312, USA
reviews: Bottomless mimosas, with savory contemporary American food with southern influences. This north side gem will not disappoint. The herb and cheese omelet was amazing, I added the lump crab and Alaskan crab to it, and made heavenly. The vanilla malt cheese cake, was the perfect way to finish a wonder brunch meal. I highly recommended asking for Mairin, she will move mountains for you!

Had another wonderful brunch at Sage today. My husband and I had the Bloody Mary's then shared the deviled eggs. The drinks had the most interesting vegetables, pickled okra, a pickle slice, radish slices, olives, thyme sprigs, and grape tomatoes and were very good. He ordered the French Toast which came piled high with fruit. He gave me a small bite which had a syrup that wasn't too sweet.  I had the Poached Eggs on Crab Cakes which came with mixed vegetables. The eggs were cooked perfectly. Then for dessert he had ice cream, 1 scoop of vanilla and 1 scoop of chocolate malt. Both were made there. I had the key lime pie with a coconut crust covered with marshmallow cream-need I say more?  It was SO good. Everything was perfectly prepared.

Make sure you have a reservation, we were lucky enough to get in early and there was seating available in the "bistro seating" aka bar area. Woody (the bar tender) was great. It started to get busy after we sat down so things took a bit. But patience is a virtue, especially waiting for food like this! Everything, including the drinks, was amazing!!!
This place is a favorite of my wife and I. We come here almost everytime we have a date night. The bartenders are always nice and the food is always good. Great coffee

We tried this restaurant recently. We took seats at the bar and ordered drinks. Friendly bartender and we liked the room and the vibe all around. We tried a couple of their apps, all creative and good. We left wanting to come back, sit down and have the full performance.

name: Backwoods Crossing
address: 6725 Mahan Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: This. Let me find the words. This is a delectable gourmet restaurant that you would imagine to be featured on the Food Network and the idea that it has not been ... YET. Well. Let’s hope this review takes you to this hidden gem before a wait list is made to get in the door. Nestled by a vegetable garden, right off I10, Backwoods Crossing is a white cottage on the outside and a sleek dining experience on the inside. The Seafood Heaven is an upscale spin on shrimp and grits and the Hen on the Hog a cordon bleu remaster. I cannot stress the importance of this hidden gem! These are the places that make being a foodie so much fun.
Everything was very tasty and the wait staff was friendly. Started with the best mozzarella sticks we'd every had. I had Hog in the Henhouse and my wife had the Beast burger. Highly recommended!

We had an amazing experience at Backwoods Crossing tonight! Symone was our waitress and she was friendly, attentive, and helpful. We would love to have her as our waitress again in the future! The food was so wonderful--very fresh and flavorful. We can't wait to try more of the menu as soon as we can! The star of our meal was the dessert. It was creative and out-of-the-box and by far one of the best we've ever had dining out. Thank you for a lovely dining experience!

Had the beef tips salad with bacon dressing.  Absolutely delicious.  Service was excellent.  Everyone enjoyed their meal.  Walking in the garden seeing the quail turkey rabbits and chicken was fun.  Great place to eat.  Looking forward to going back!
