Wonderful food, well-executed, fantastic service. Friendly atmosphere, relaxed and welcoming. I enjoyed walking the garden out front and all the specials incorporating seasonal ingredients. Would have been a 5-star review except for the use of Mason jars as beverage glasses. We were served a beer in a Mason jar. Get some actual dishes, please.

name: Cypress Restaurant
address: 320 E Tennessee St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: We had a wonderful dinner at Cypress. They have a valet outside if it gets really busy so it’s very convenient. It was very close to our hotel and I saw the high ratings so we thought we give it a chance. The waiter was very professional and when asked which items he preferred, he gave us honest answers. We started with the pork cheeks appetizer which was sublime. It was so tender and delicious. We both got the hanger steak, which was perfectly seasoned and even had a little bit of a kick to it. The mashed potatoes were delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant.

One of the cleanest and neatest restaurants I have been in Tallahassee. This is so important factor to me that I started my review with. I had mushroom 🍄 soup 🥣 which was delicious and I recommend it to those who like their soup creamy instead of watery. We had butter lobster 🦞 and steak 🥩 big dishes. Both very tasty! The service is good and staff are nice. Great place for special occasions!

I only got to go there once.  I want to go again.  The only thing I did not like about it was the big scary trucks whizzing by on Tennessee Street,  LOL but that's not their fault.  I found the atmosphere cozy and warm and I recall our server being very attentive.  The scallops I had there were the best and I do mean the best scallops I've ever eaten,  bar none.  Kudos!
What a wonderful place! Friendly staff, comfortable surroundings. I had a delicious red wine recommended by the staff with a delicious bowl of French onion soup.

Went here to celebrate an occasion. Had heard about the renovations and thought it would be fun to visit and see the changes. To our disappointment, it really hasn't changed much and even worse, the quality of food has drastically declined. We won't be going back here for a very long time. Hope they are able to bounce back and make some major improvements so the quality of food served matches the prices they are charging.

name: Kool Beanz Cafe
address: 921 Thomasville Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Our favorite place to eat in Tallahassee...food choices vary frequently but they keep several of the staples on the menu such as the steak...my personable favorite, along with the lettuce wedge. Food is always fresh and made to order. They allow corkage for a reasonable charge of $10. No reservations taken so we try to arrive early so we don’t have much of a wait. Service is good. We enjoy sitting at the bar to watch the cooking.

Kool Beanz never fails to offer interesting and great tasting food. Every time I go back there are old favorites along with new delicious entrees. There is also a good wine list to compliment the food.

Best fine dining in the capital city! Rotating menu but always something good on tap. Great seating, eccentric flavors and staff, a joy every time we come to Kool Beans. Get there early because they stay PACKED and parking can be limited in peak hours. Save room for the homemade desserts, you’ll regret if you don’t.

Great food, helpful staff, cute atmosphere. There's a pretty big patio, but inside seating is limited. I would suggest making a reservation. There's an open kitchen so you can watch the magicians behind the counter cook your food. We probably ordered too much but everything on the menu looked amazing! 

Be aware that the menu changes daily, so if you're like me and prefer to thoroughly research before going somewhere, try to go in with an open mind. You won't regret it!!!

Absolutely amazing!  I enjoyed my meal from the cafe style bar with a full view of the culinary artists preparing the food.  My meal and service were impressive, ambiance impeccable.  One of the best recommendations I've ever received.  Kudos to the team at Kool Beanz!

name: Bella Bella
address: 123 E 5th Ave, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: We had such a beautiful mother and daughter group meal here. It’s such a cool building and the food is fresh and delicious

I love this place. I wish it was around when I went to college in Tallahassee. It's a very large restaurant but it's broken up in sections so it feels intimate. Very cozy. The bubble bread is to die for. Last time I was there I had one of the specials. I think it was some sort of mushroom ravioli delicious. Friend had the lasagna which is always a winner. Staff is young but very and know how to do their job well. There is a great bar for waiting for a table. They have very good house wine. it's family-oriented but also a great place to take dates or for anniversaries.  Always a thumbs up.

Was invited here for a double. Fantastic, eclectic experience with world-class chefs producing delicious meals. This almost beats every other restaurant, is priced perfectly and even when packed—has the capacity & service to deliver. We love this place for Italian Traditional, Seafood dishes, and dynamic salads.

I love Bella Bella and eat there often. The ambiance, the food, the staff are always friendly, knowledgeable and efficient! When I eat there with friends, they ask me "What's good here?" and I always answer with confidence "Everything!"

Great experience and a calm atmosphere. The servers are always attentive and polite. The portions fit the price, and while the menu is short, it offers a great deal of fresh variety. Many of the items are prepared unique to Bella Bella, so even dishes you have tried elsewhere may tingle your palate in a different way. Overall it was a wonderful experience, and we will definitely be returning in the future. (PS. Try the Bubble Bread, it is delicious and melty.)

name: Ted's Montana Grill
address: 1954 Village Green Way, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: A friend and I visited on a Wednesday around 12:30 pm, during lunch rush.  The place was packed (always a good sign) and there was a short wait, but seating inside and out to sit while we waited.  The inside has a really great atmosphere, upscale casual, with many patrons wearing white collar business attire, and also intimate.  The lighting was dim, but not so much that it is hard to see what is being served.  The staff was pleasant and service was prompt.  My friend and I both ordered a burger, he tried the knife-and-fork and I got the Avalon.  I loved my burger!  The flavors of the arugula and cheeses were rich, but paired perfectly!  I would definitely order something different next time with faith that it would be equally delicious.  My friends burger was very good, especially if you like a little spice.  It was spicier than I expected but someone looking for a little giddy up with their meal would really enjoy this burger!  For two non-alcoholic drinks and two burger entrees, plus a 25 percent tip, the bill was about 50 dollars.  A little pricey to just satisfy a burger craving on a lunch break, but the service and ambiance was well worth it!  I'd highly recommend visiting this establishment and hope to do so again soon.

We brought my in-laws family here last Sunday (Father's Day). The steaks were great. We ordered both beef and bison to compare the taste, flavor and texture. I like both. Bison was just a bit chewier than beef. One of my kids liked bison and the other preferred beef. My father in-laws thought bison was more flavorful and a bit sweeter than beef and he loved it. The Chili soup was one of the best. I like the fresh pickled cucumber but the rest of my family didn't. They didn't serve bread and butter at beginning and all of us preferred that way so we could enjoy the main meal better.

Solid four.  Ted's is on the higher side of casual dining with an unpretentious vibe.   Sort of reminds me of places I've been out West, San Antonio so many years ago.  Jyes, bison's on the menu.  

Love the space, the feeling.  Everyone was especially nice front to back.  Popped in this time for drinks and snacks so we sat at the bar ...all the way down unnecessarily for whatever reason open facing the line cooks, which was actually fun because they sort of indulged us with soft interest like sitting in with the chef.  Was fun.  Burger came to order spot on, good luck with that elsewhere.

Been in a number of times passing through town over the years, sort of look forward to it.  We need you in Orlando.

follow up 3-4-20 - after an uncharacteristic  disappointing visit I was contacted by corporate and sent a gift card and invited back for another try.  First of all, that action speaks volumes about Ted's and their customer focus.  Went back yesterday and everything was wonderful.  Appetizers, entrees and dessert: presentation, portion, taste and temperature were spot on and our server Emmanuel was on his game: friendly, respectful, attentive and efficient.  We will be back for sure !!

Delicious, home style food, great service, great atmosphere. Love the private booths. Never had a bad experience here. They've been around a while, clearly they have the recipe for success. If you haven't been, go! You won't regret it.

name: Midtown Caboose
address: 1406 N Meridian Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews:
Nice ambiance,  superb selection of sandwiches,  burgers and main courses. Good selection of drinks.
Helpful,  friendly service

Excellent food, and plenty of it. Convenient mid town location as the name says.  Please support our local businesses and establishments during these "viral" times. Midtown Caboose is open for carry out. Call or order online before you head over, and your order will be waiting, and will be brought out to you.
 Enjoy! Five stars all around!!!

Good atmosphere. Server was friendly and fast. Tables, chairs, utensils and menus were clean. Food was good and plentiful. I came here with my significant other and for two drinks and two burgers and fries the total bill was 35$ but we were full! (The sweet potato fried had cinnamon sugar on them.)

Visiting in town for work, it was suggested we try this burger place for the "Mac Daddy" it was awesome as was the "Liberty Bell" a Philly cheese steak on a cheeseburger with garlic fries. To say it was Great is not enough. It was the best cheeseburger I have ever had in my travels!!

Midtown Caboose offers a wide variety of specialty sandwiches, burgers, wraps and salads. My first tip is if you are going to check them out for the first time read their menu online ahead of time. There are so many choose and flavor combinations it can be hard to narrow down your selection. Each of their creations has been perfectly crafted to create the best flavors. Take for instance their Shepard's Pie Burger. Everything you love about a Shepard's Pie morphed magically into a burger! This burger is very filling and because of the mashed potatoes on the burger I suggest opting out of the fries for another one of their great sides. The servers are fast and attentive. They also have a great outdoors seating area out back.

name: Table 23
address: 1215 Thomasville Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Our party of 3 ordered the brisket sandwich, southern Reuben sandwich, and the gumbo/southern salad combo. All entrees were delicious with generous portions. The sides with the sandwiches were outstanding and freshly prepared. The gumbo was perfectly balanced with flavor and spice. Additionally the sangrias (red and white) were very good. We enjoyed the outside dining area and would definitely recommend a visit!
Beautifully relaxed atmosphere. Great for a date night. The food is phenomenal. I recommend the coconut shrimp and scallops. So good. We ate the shrimp faster than I could take pics.
Two things that are difficult to find in Tallahassee... consistently delicious food and an awesome atmosphere. Love this place!

Such a big fan of this place. Love the fact it’s family owned and operated. Food is amazing, staff is attentive, and the location is just beautiful. Table 23 is a consistent favorite of mine. If you enjoy pork, please try the 3 little pigs as it is so full of flavor and just great. Drinks are also great here too!

All I had heard about this restaurant was positive. I decided to try this restaurant the other day. The fact is that we got there 10 minutes before the kitchen closed. I had a fried catfish and my partner had a salmon. The salmon was honestly yummy. However, I had the worst catfish in my life. The crust was too thick and too salty. After I removed the crust, I got two 2-inch pieces of fish. I was shocked by the fact that the chef used very tiny portions of the fish to serve us. And, how he could make the crust that salty and thick. Not to mention that half of the fish was not cooked at all. The atmosphere, wait staff and everything else was great. Just don't go there anytime close to their closing business hour.

name: Lucilla
address: 1241 E Lafayette St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: The warm, comfortable atmosphere starts with the greeting at the door, extends to the wait staff and is present in the food. The Snapper St. Charles is our favorite dish. The fish is perfectly cooked and nestled on a bed of whipped potatoes and amply covered with crab meat. Fresh pecans surround the plate and a stack of sweet potato ribbons tops it off. All of the flavors blend nicely together with the excellent sauce that is never too much, however has a bit of a bite. Good selections of beer and wine, soft lighting and comfortable seating make for an excellent evening.
The food at this place is amazing.  The service is excellent and the staff is extremely attentive.  I have been here a few times and it continues to exceed my expectations.

Very pleased to have found such good food amongst all the chains and collegiate dives. Light elegantly prepared appetizers. Tasty entrees (loved the shrimp and grits). Nice wine selection. (no bar) Reasonable prices. 

Don't let the pizza hut exterior fool you... Great place for a good dinner!

The conch here is amazing. It was very tender.I was given rice and mac and cheese. The owner left me Try the mac and cheese and it was amazing. It's considered Bahamian style Mack and cheese. It's well seasoned. It's not the typical mac and cheese. The owner actually cooks the food, which is very good. The inside of the restaurant is set up like it's still in bananas.

I came for lunch with a friend and I had the snapper dish. Everything was cooked nicely and the portion size was good. The restaurant was a little slow in service.  The sauce on the fish was amazing. The mashed potatoes and the sweet potato ribbons could have used a little more flavor. I would definitely come back.

name: Shula's 347 Grill
address: 415 N Monroe St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: We had a great dinner at Shula's to celebrate an FSU graduation. Very friendly staff, who seem genuinely glad to see us. The food was awesome. Two of us got the salmon dish, which was among the best I've had. The service was good too. The only gripe is that it took a longer time than usual to get the entrees. They were running full tilt that night. The manager gave us complimentary desserts which was a nice gesture.

Good food, is it worth the value? Maybe. Staff was attentive and on point. We got the Scallop appetizer which was $21 for three tiny scallops,  yet pretty tasty. I got steak medallions which were also cooked pretty perfectly.  
I don't know what it is,  but its hard to see the value when the food is almost bland compared to other places in town.  Creme brulee was good! I'm just not blown away.  Although if I had to return with no other options, I would. Hard sell for me.

I wanted ribs but they didn't have any at the time so I had conch balls, Mac and cheese and collard greens for dinner. The food was very filling and good. Great seasoning on the food as well. First time here and will come back.
Very good! Been quite a few years. Love the new menu!

Lovely place! Joe, at the bar, was very knowledgeable and so caring with his work. Be sure to ask for their specials here! If you're looking for a steak and a steak well done then come here. 
Pictured: Blackened Scallops. 14oz NY Strip with Parm Risotto and Roasted Corn.

name: Masa
address: 1650 N Monroe St, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Nice place to eat lunch and dinner. Staff is very friendly. They have the best deals for lunch and they are very quick. Food tastes great. The menu has very good variety of food. Love their sashimi/sushi hand rolls. Plenty of parking at the front and side of the restaurant. The seating and light setup is really nice even at daytime.
The food and service was great. I apologize for the pictures, I took them after we started eating. Lol we also enjoyed the plum wine as well. Its has a sweet and robust flavor to me.

Love this place.  Always great service and quality food.  Staff knows menu very well so ask questions. Great atmosphere.  

Keep coming back because it is good
Their fried rice is not vegan, it contains eggs. Which I didn't realize initially but the staff kindly replaced my meal with an egg-free tufo-based after I called, for free. And it's delicious!
Loved it!!! The food is amazing, this place is Talahasse's best kept secret! I highly recommend it

name: Clusters & Hops
address: 707 N Monroe St, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Ended up here after a softball game on a Saturday at lunchtime with 8 of us I was thinking we would wait forever. We were seated right away, and the server was great. Drinks and the appetizer were put in right away. I ordered a chicken, spinach, peppers and rice bowl. Hubby ordered the French dip sandwich. I hands down recommend the rice bowl, very good!!

Delicious hidden gem of Tallahassee! They are a very small establishment so getting there early is advisable. However lunch is equally as amazing as their dinner menu. They also have a small shop when you first walk in that sells wine and cheese too.

Cozy little nice place. You enter and find yourself in the rows of wine 🍷 We started with eggplant lavosh with truffle oil and goat 🐐 cheese 🧀 which was “very” delicious! Sole fish 🎣 and pork main dishes were tasty and beautifully decorated. The staff share the details of ingredients when they serve your dish.

This is my forth visit. I went with a friend last Fry and we shared some appetizers: of course the mac & cheese and the quesadillas and they were sooo good! I had the tuna tartar which was beyond words, for taste & presentation and my friend had the chicken pizza which was also amazing and plenty of food! So I’ll be back soon!!

Wonderful experience and service! Decided to go out for a fancy dinner and Clusters & Hops came up. They do not disappoint! Food was excellent and had a wonderful presentation for each dish. The service was impeccable as well. 

The only thing I could say about the experience, is I would like to see more cheese on the Cheese Board. That's a rather expensive cheese board for how little cheese you actually get. Other then that, the cheese was excellent!

I highly recommend this place!

name: Bird's Aphrodisiac Oyster Shack
address: 325 N Bronough St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Great dinner, drinks, and atmosphere with live music!   I loved the Oysters Rockefeller.  Indoor and covered outdoor seating.  Small space, but great atmosphere.  Be aware that Bird's doesn't always offer table service.  If no one shows up to your table, order at the bar.

Excellent oysters
We had a delicious lunch at this low key bar.  The oysters were just terrific - we had them raw and they were plump, fresh and juicy.  We loved our grouper sandwich with a large perfectly grilled moist grouper fillet!  It was quite reasonably priced too.

Our agency catered  a meal from here, and I had a basic hamburger. Phenomenal quality for such a simple meal. I cannot wait to visit this place in my downtime and see what else they have on their menu.
Great burger and beer joint.  Relaxed atmosphere and friendly service.  Try splitting a cheese burger and the bbq dogs (comes with 2) with a friend.

I am an oyster fan and all, but I think their strong suit is their burgers.  Awesome! And this place is really fun.  Sometimes they stop table service when it is busy, so come here to have fun, not for a fine-dining experience, and you’ll be alright!

name: BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse
address: 1749 Apalachee Pkwy, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Very friendly staff and lots of room. The menu is extensive and has something for everyone including a "gluten"free section. I was greeted by a very courteous hostess and was offered a seat at a table or I could take any high top or bar seat available so I chose the bar. My server was prompt and explained the menu and even recommended a couple of items. The food was very good and the portion was quite sufficient. The server was friendly and the service was excellent. I would eat here again if i am in the area.

I had the Atlantic Salmon,  Broiled. It was awesome. Ate everything.  Came with this delicious sauce that made it go POW! lol

Not spicy, not overly seasoned. It is seasoned to perfection and leaves you wanting more. I was stuffed! It was great. I will order again.

We had a nice experience tonight. Clark was our server and he did a great job. He interacted with us well, he was very educated with the menu. The food was wonderful and it came out in a timely manner. We will definitely ask for him again next time we come in.

To be honest this was a very different type of restaurant. They have amazing drinks by far.. In house beer, wine, liquor and more. I think that the menu might have been a bit pricey for the type of food that they were serving. Extremely Innovative but just different, for example the appetizer of the avocado egg rolls was very interesting. The pizza is always a great choice nothing like having brussel sprouts and asparagus on your pizza!! As always the sandwich was delicious so I do plan on coming back to this place mostly because of desert. which was a huge baked cookie and ice cream on top!!!!

Truly disappointed. Ordered online and picked it up. Just got a salad but they put cheese on it when I customized the order and made sure cheese was taken out. Portion size was very small. I eat in the store all the time and I order the same salad: take out was 3x smaller and I paid $17 for it. Very disappointed and I will never order take out again.

name: Wells Brothers Bar and Grill
address: 1710 W Tharpe St, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Stopped in for lunch - the burgers were awesome and HUGE! I had the Lip Smacker with a side of pasta salad. Absolutely delicious. They have a patio area in the back that is shaded with picnic tables and tables with umbrellas. Highly recommend this place to anyone wanting amazing food in a fun, laid back environment.

This used to be my hands down favorite restaurant in town but ever since they reopened its been a disappointment. They halved the size of the menu, but more importantly they reduced the quality of the food. The burgers used to be big and like 1.5” thick and now they are about half that size, and they switched from real cheese to what appears to be Kraft slices (really??). The prices however are the same, why would I pay $13 for a burger the same quality as a $6 one at relish down the street? They also changed the inside, it used to be kinda cool and cozy inside with old wood tables and dark red paint, but know it feels like I’m in a psychiatric ward as they painted it off-white and replaced the wood tables with cheap plastic ones. I really don’t know why they changed the place everyone liked it before, I hope they return to their old menu and ingredients before people stop coming back.

Wonderful place. The burgers are amazing, the option of being able to build your own burger is quite cool. The range of options can be intimidating but it's super fun to do. The staff are also quite  helpful. Also they have a 25% discount for FSU/DAMU/TCC students who have a valid id! Definitely recommend it.

I was so excited for them to reopen, but am saddened by the changes. They downsized the menu, downsized the burger weight by 60-70%, and kept the prices the same or increased them. I had been a loyal customer for over a year, but I don't think I'll be returning. The only upside is their fries are still great.

Good food with a lot of options. They are quick and food tastes good each time! Fair prices. Good parking each time. The place is actually bigger than it looks. There is large backroom with TVs. They mostly have sports on. Servers are students but they are quick and nice. Most importantly food is very fresh. They have the best sweet potato fries in town. Just give it a shot and you will not regret.

name: Georgio's Fine Food and Spirits
address: 2971 Apalachee Pkwy, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: My husband took me to Georgio's tonight for a quiet celebration of my birthday. It was just our second time there, the first being his job's Christmas party. Like the first time, the food and service were absolutely amazing!! He had the Delmonico steak and I had the Shrimp Scampi, and both were superb! I had a piece of Chocolate Mousse cake for my birthday cake and it was was heavenly. Nicole was a friendly & attentive server, and, of course, we were greeted by the owner when we came in. I'm already looking forward to the next time we done there!

The absolute worst experience ever at a fine dining restaurant. Me and my family have eaten here on many occasions and just recently decided to order online. I ordered over $85 in food only for my driver to arrive and the bartender be rude and non professional about the order I know was placed! I was on the phone with my driver listening how rude he was. Sad to say me and family will NOT be back and I will review throughout....On another note my driver was extremely professional and all around great.

The Delmonico steak was seasoned very well and cooked to the requested temperature. My server, Taylor, was fantastic and recommended a glass of Malbec to accompany my meal, which was delicious! Taylor helped to create a great meal. The owner, Georgio checked on me a couple of times as well. You will not regret a visit!

Great experience at this restaurant!  The grouper fingers, ribeye and carrot cake were all delicious and fresh! Brian, the bartender, went above and beyond to educate us on the menu and its offerings!  I will be back!

Classy but not overdone restaurant and lounge that pulls off being kind if homey.  The wait staff were very attentive and friendly.  The food was high quality and presented well.  Prices were a bit high, but not out of character for the area.  This would be a great spot for a gathering if you have a group - I saw several groups enjoying themselves.  It also had some quieter more private booths which would be ideal for a romantic dinner.  I chose from the specials menu, a beef bourgeois pot pie - delicious and perfect!

name: Cabo's Island Grill & Bar
address: 1221 Apalachee Pkwy, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Prices have gone up a lot for basic food.  Most better burger places around tallahassee cost around the same price.  Chips and salsa are still good and it's nice to get them with a burger.
ALWAYS fresh food and superior service. Their salsa (both hot and mild) us delicious. They also have plenty of vegetarian options and do not use lard. Great for lunch, dinner, or brunch!

2 stars for food and 5 stars for customer service. Ordered fish tacos and shrimp tacos, both were bland and the salsa tasted candy sweet. It was interesting. Food is overpriced. The service was great though. Servers were attentive and friendly.

My family loves coming here! I am a pescatarian and there are so many food options for me here. The customer service is amazing, and everyone is so sweet. Also the decorations with surf boards, and photos throughout the years give such happy, wholesome vibes! I ordered a vegetarian black bean burger and it was the best i have ever had! I wish I could give a higher review!

Service is what we came to expect (good, professional and nice). If you want a great all American hamburger, go to Cabo’s. If you are not really hungry, order the 1/4 pounder. But the 1/2 pounder is A LOT. The French Fries are so good. My spouse and mother love the chicken tacos. I’ve eaten the beef tacos and they are great to.

name: Azu Lucy Ho's
address: 3220 Apalachee Pkwy #13, Tallahassee, FL 32311, USA
reviews: As a Virginia (coastal) native, I’ve literally never had better sushi in my life. The quality of the fish is very apparent upon eating it initially, and the leftovers are almost nearly as fresh and inviting as the original product. Overall one of the best restaurants I’ve ever had the fortune of dining from, 10/10 would definitely recommend.

This Benihana has been the most consistent and convenient out of all the locations I've visited down here. Parking is easy, food is consistently good as well as the chefs and servers. One thing I would suggest is making a reservation. Walk-in times can be pretty long for dinner.
Great job! Good was served Hot and fresh, Great customer service. Love the Reno!

First time trying the Seafood Fried Rice was very good.  I was excited to return with a friend.  Second time, not so good.  The shrimp, salmon, and scallops have a light coating of something, maybe cornstarch, which is unique, however this time, the seafood just tastes...  wet.  Like it was previously frozen and just barely heated?  I don't know, but we'll probably stick with our favorite place: Kiku.

Haven't eaten here in over 10 years. The first time I ate here the food was wonderful. But I ordered food last night for me and my husband, it was my husband's first time trying this restaurant. But the food was horrible the food tasted burnt the beans that they put on my general chicken was burnt there was so much sauce on it you can not even taste the chicken.

name: Sahara Cafe. Mediterranean Cuisine
address: 1135 Apalachee Pkwy, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Lovely 💕 place! Delicious and very authentic food. Our server Maddy was so sweet and made excellent food and drink suggestions. Everything was top notch and affordable. 👏

I have been going to Sahara for years, but then somehow hadn't gone since their move until today. Hubby took me for lunch, and wow was it delicious! I had the gyro wrap (add feta), and it was absolutely amazing. I marveled over it multiple times. I was also impressed with the amount of nice, thick-cut meat on the wrap. It's not some dinky little wrap, this thing is full & hearty! My husband got the beef shawarma (add feta), which has french fries in it, and wow that was really tasty as well. The flavors of the 2 wraps were completely different, but both equally yummy. I will definitely be back again soon, and not let so much time pass again before returning! Two thumbs up for sure!

Amazing authentic middle eastern food! Went there for a business dinner and their staff was very helpful and attentive. The food is delicious. We ordered 5 different plates and were not disappointed. There is a lot of food competition in this area, you can’t go wrong with this choice.

It wasn’t awful but they were out of Greek Salad and service was real slow initially. There was a lot of meat but the food tasted just meh. Two plates and Two drinks cost us $45 +tip..probably could have been better spent elsewhere. Our server was polite and knowledgeable but it just wasn’t the 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 (4.7 star) place online claimed. Maybe it was just an off night. i can see why people like it I’m just not sure if I’d do dinner again.

Tried and enjoyed the delicious Chicken Shawama Plate and the Combo plate-has both chicken and Gyro meat.  For dessert we had Baklava Walnut and Baklava Pistachio.  Excellent food, service and ambiance!

name: Shell Oyster Bar
address: 14 Famu Way, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: It just doesn't get any better than this. One might easily overlook this former gas station but in doing so would miss some of the best seafood in north Florida. It's nothing fancy but the food is divine. The homemade cocktail sauce is practically worth the trip. I can't resist the oysters on the half shell or the seafood platter.
This place is the very best for fresh shucked oysters, seafood and the best home-made slaw ever!
The BEST oysters and fried shrimp in town.  LOVE this place.  Have been eating at Shell for 20+ years and have NEVER been disappointed.  Great family owned business
Great food. Great service.  Great atmosphere. The very best raw oysters and fresh fried local seafood. Best by far in Tallahassee. No other seafood compares in Tallahassee.

This place is a hidden gem in Tallahassee. The food is amazing! I visit during lunch and am in the door as soon as they open as the place is small and they fill up fast! Once you’ve had their nuked oysters, you’ll see why. As you’re walking in, the waiters are taking your orders and by the time you’re seated, you have drinks and apps served. This place moves fast. But you don’t feel rushed. Everyone is super friendly. Don’t come in expecting fine dining. Your food is served in reusable baskets, with packaged silverware and paper cups. But who cares when you’re being served fresh, hot seafood and great sides! The only downside is that they are CASH ONLY which can be a bit inconvenient for those of us who rarely carry cash. Other than that, I have no complaints. Love this place!

name: Wahoo Seafood Grill
address: 2714 Graves Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: I went on Monday for the ALL YOU CAN EAT crab and it was simple but great. Service was excellent. It wasn't like some restaurants where they have you wait between refills, rather they replace your crab before you even finish. They keep you topped off. Crab is well cooked with Old Bay and is brought to the table hot. You can get light, medium, or heavy seasoning. I recommend lessening the seasoning as your feast goes on. I also tried the Mac and Cheese because other reviews recommended it, and it was also delicious. Reminded me of a sharply flavored pub cheese dipping sauce. They encourage you to get your money's worth and more. I will definitely be back.

I went here to celebrate two of my friends birthday. Our party of eight had a awesome time. The food was good. We tried the majority of their appetizers which were great. We were full by the time our main course arrived. The staff was very courteous and attentive. Our birthday patrons also received a large peice of key lime pie for free.  What more could we ask for.👍🏾

This is a really good seafood restaurant for someplace not on the coast. Fried shrimp were excellent and the fries are delicious. I had the seafood jambalaya and it was excellent. It had just the right kick and lots of seafood. Very surprised to find this quality seafood inland away from the coast. We have also eaten at their Gainesville restaurant and both are worth trying.

I recently took my family here for a seafood feast. The appetizers were great (gator tail and calamari). We got mixtures of boils and fried fish. The fried items we're done right with minimal breading and weren't greasy. It was all tasty. My only criticism is that you should consider adding more higher end beer options.

Wow this place is awesome! On our way to Tampa we found this place and turned out to be one of our beat experiences in this trip. We ordered crab which was great and well marinated. The house made burger was a class upper than what I’ve hd so far. If it happens to go to Tallahassee make sure you visit this place.

name: The Bada Bean
address: 2500 Apalachee Pkwy # B, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: This is THE place to bring visiting family and friends. I visit or order on my own at least once a month. We love to stop by after Mass on a Sunday morning.I told my daughtera her husband and my ex who visits two times a year, how wonderful Bada Bean is. Now they agree and it's a regular to dine there when they come down. I love the pancakes.

This has to be the best breakfast place in Tallahassee!  Been driving by this place for years and finally gave it a try... should have done that a long time ago.

Corned beef has was perfect. All ingredients are fresh and great quality. Staff is friendly and efficient.  

Better get here early though it fills up fast.

Wow, just WOW!   The nice valet dude at the hotel recommend this for breakfast.  We're so glad that we took his recommendation.  Sat outside on a beautiful day.   We at the Hot Brown and the Veggie Skillet (with a pancake side!).  Amazing!   We enjoyed it so much we thought we'd come back for lunch but alas we ran out of time. Next time though!   The service was excellent.  Def recommending stopping by here for breakfast or lunch.

Cute little brunch spot that is buzzing with business my husband and I stopped in for brunch on a Sunday and were quickly seated. The resturant was packed but service was quick and the food was food. Their coffee bar is a nice touch and we were pleased with our visit!

Love love loved it! This was my first time coming to Bada Bean with my family and we will definitely be going back. I had the farmer skillet with avocado and mushroom added. It was pure perfection 😍. My husband had the eggs Benedict which was amazing too. My kid had the cinnamon roll pancake. Everybody tasted everybody's food and we all agreed that each other's for was tasty. If you want a good breakfast or brunch in Tallahassee I highly recommend it. Mine was so good I would go back just to get the same thing. Food was perfectly seasoned and nothing extra was needed to make it delicious although next time I might try the Siracha 🤔. The service was great. Really friendly wait staff- not just the super cute young lady that served us.

name: Andrew's Downtown
address: 228 S Adams St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Really well done food. The Fino burger was phenomenal, to say the least!! Ryan was a great waiter as well.

The lunch buffet was great. We appreciated it that the staff allowed us to eat when it was about to close. It suggests not only the kindness of staff but also a good working place that staff would like to walk extra miles to make commitment.

Andrew's is a GREAT place to eat weather if your looking for a savory delicious bite to eat or just wsnt to kick back and have some drinks and enjoy the friendly bar staff they have a bunch of big screen TV'S and the friendly staff is always willing to put on what ever game you want to watch!! I highly recommend Andrew's!!

I has the shrimp Florentine.  Fresh shrimp, shredded parm.

Food came quickly and great temp.

Nice local downtown. Easy walk from local hotels.

You may see some politicians here :)
Patio seating was great.  Sassy shrimp was delicious.  Florida Orange Cake was fantastic!Staff was very attentive.  I will definitely be back when I visit again.

name: Maple Street Biscuit Company- FSU
address: 1600 W Call St, Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews: I moved to Tallahassee 2 months ago and had trouble finding a restaurant that makes my favorite breakfast food, biscuits and gravy. This restaurant has the BEST biscuits and gravy in town! The sausage gravy was savory, and the biscuits are baked to perfection. I also ordered a vanilla maple iced latte and hash brown cake, which were equally as delightful. I will definitely be ordering from here again!

Yes! They are open! 
Hands down some of the best breakfast/lunch in town, and a perfect outing. They have a great system amidst the current quarantine conditions, so don’t hesitate to stop by. 

The food is top notch, and very good. The squawking goat and sticky maple were BEAST!

Maple Street Biscuit Company is a great place for a quick breakfast or brunch. Biscuits with all kinds of toppings are available for all tastes. The waffles are also an excellent choice. Variety of coffees are also brewed up. Very relaxed and casual dining. Give it a try the next time you are in Tallahassee.

Yum! We visited the original location in St. Augustine, so when we were in Tallahassee with my father, I jumped at the option to take him. The food is great! Our group has a vegetarian, and she appreciates the mushroom gravy. For the meat-eater in our group, the 5 and dime is a hit! We also love their fresh OJ.  We'll be back again.

Delicious food with friendly staff! 
If you are not local to the area and enjoybiscuits, you definitely need to check out this place! Flaky biscuits, crispy fried chicken and rich flavored gravy! 

Will definitely come back when I return or am near the area!

name: Reangthai Thai Restaurant
address: 2740 Capital Cir NE, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: I placed a grub hub order. pad Thai was missing some ingredients.. nuts, basil, and flavour. Also requested medium spice.... nope!! The Panama curry was watery/ dilute and flavours were amiss... disappointing.
Big bold flavors with a nice finesse.  My family and I had a great experience here and the food was very good.

Always my favorite place to go for really authentic Thai food. The mango duck curry is extremely good. Also, the specials such as pumpkin Curry and the Kings river are amazing too. Prices are a little pricey, but well worth it when you consider the owner buys things fresh and curates these recipes herself. She will come out and greet you and ask how your meal was. The Kings river may be one of the best meals I've ever had. One word of caution: spice is no joke here. If you can't handle spicy, be sure you get the lowest spice setting. Hot pushes it and Thai hot is even more intense.
Atmosphere, service, and food was superlative. Pad Thai with extra chili sauce was amazing. Bangkok Chicken was perfectly prepared. We will definitely return.

We could see this place being amazing. The coconut broth shrimp soup was great!!! The two entree specials we ordered (red snapper, and duck) had great sauce, plenty of good veggies but the meat on both dishes where over cooked. The fish was dry and duck was not what it could have been. We will definitely come back to try more soups, ice cream, and the curry dishes. 
Soups are great here!!!!
Friendly staff and nice atmosphere.

name: Coosh's Bayou Rouge Restaurant
address: 6267 Old Water Oak Rd #101, Tallahassee, FL 32312, USA
reviews:
I had been here one time before, several years ago but I never wrote a review. So here it is now.

It was great! The portions of food were large and I felt like there was good value for the money. The staff was polite and friendly too. Out party sat outside, so I cannot comment too much how thr atmosphere was inside, but it seemed nice. Everyone (including myself) enjoyed our food :)

I'd you like Cajun food, give it a shot!
One of the best places to eat in Tallahassee. Locally owned and amazing food. You have to try the shrimp and grits.

This was the best meal I have experienced since arriving in Tallahassee! I was expecting basic....but everything was perfectly seasoned, hot, and quick service.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting. I was even impressed by the blue cheese dressing for my salad! Best I've ever had!

I love Cajun food I've been to a few places around town and this place by far serves the best tijan deliciousness you could ask for. If you're from here or if you're not from here and you want some good Cajun food please try Coosh's. Not only is the food great, but you have really good customer service. This is a great place it's a great part of our community and what makes this place really special is that they're just plain honest. I cannot wait to return and eat some of that good food.
The food tastes so fresh! Our waitresses was very helpful and assists in our order. First time here and we will be back!!

name: Liberty Bar and Restaurant
address: 1307 N Monroe St, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: I love this place. The food is excellent and unique and the bar has a great selection of excellent options. The staff here is friendly and knowledgeable and always happy to answer any questions you have and to help put together just the right meal and cocktail for you. I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

Excellent food, great service, wonderful drink selection. The only con was the noise. Hard floors and a black brick wall just bounce sounds everywhere, so there was just a lot of ambient noise. Not enough to keep you away, but enough to make you have to be in the mood to cope with it. I'd still go back - definitely worth it.

Delicious creative food combinations that taste a little different with every bite. The atmosphere was relaxing, soft lighting sets the mood. I didn't partake in the alcohol options but the menu of mixed drinks was extensive and creative. A must try is the butternut squash cheesecake.

I like this place,  service can be slow depending on where you sit, but I keep going back for the food!! I was literally blown away by the steak frites... I mean... WHOA. The flavor kept exploding in my mouth with every bite! Other options on the menu have not disappointed either.  Don't miss your chance to try this place,  even if you're not there to drink.

Liberty has a good happy hour and a cozy atmosphere. I'd recommend it for dates, a fancy dinner with friends or even just a drink after work. Parking can be tight at times, but you can usually find a spot in the lot or across the street.

name: Sakura Japanese Sushi & Grill
address: 1318 N Monroe St, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: This is the best place. Food is amazing and always fresh. Service is always on point. They have great specials at lunch time as well. I have been going here since they opened and now they have expanded for more seating so less wait time which is great as well. Great place to come on a date night or just hanging out with friends.

This is actually one of my favorite lunch sushi place.  Lunch special price is very reasonable, my favorite chirashi is almost half price, such a great deal. I once orders a bunch of fancy sushi, and all of them are fantastic. Love the place. 
Fair warning, go early for lunch, or service can get a bit slow.

Went there for Christmas dinner with another couple.  It was very busy, but the waitress did a great job and food was 5 star except for calamari appetizer.  It was a little tough and over fried.  Everything else was delicious.  Will definitely go back.
Great service and food as well as atmosphere...
Oh my goodness - delicious food, good lunch portions and prices!! Service was also pretty great.

name: The Blu Halo
address: 3431 Bannerman Rd #2, Tallahassee, FL 32312, USA
reviews:
We went out for date night and had a wonderful experience! The service was excellent five stars for that alone! 
Our appetizer was Caprese salad and was fantastic. We ordered happy hour drinks ( Friday till 7pm ) all our drinks were very good. 
We both ordered off the night specials my wife got the brazed short rib and it was simply amazing, I ordered the dry aged Kansas strip and for the cost it is one of the best meals I have had.
I have to say this was a great value for an evening out and we will be back.

I was very happy with my food and drinks here.  Had grapefruit mimosas and the halo omelet. That was amazing and a lot of food! I opted for grits instead of the potatoes and think that was a better choice. Expect to spend some time here if you go on a Sunday; it's supposed to be leisurely.  All in all, a great experience.

We came to Blu Halo when it first opened and we were not impressed. We gave it a second chance tonight and the food was tasty. My wife had the Blu Halo pork chop (2 bone chop) covered in a blueberry compote, goat cheese, with mashed potatoes. I had the Southern Grouper (blackened) with southern style collard greens, and thick, creamy grits. The service and food was wonderful. We will be back.

We came for the steak!  Cool atmosphere and the wait staff was on  point. Desert was great and the live music was subtle and entertaining.  We asked for the “best cut” steak in the house and it was great, however we didn’t “prefer” the coffee ground marinade on the steak.  Great steak, Great Cut, Cooked perfectly, our preference is wood fires with no coffee.
Will return and recommend. Thanks

The pickled Bloody Mary is to die for as I LOVE  spicy any day!  Had the eggs, bacon and house potatoes which were all cooked to perfection!!!  

We had a party of 8 and they allowed us to enjoy almost 2-1/2 hours dining with them. Great ambience and fabulous hosts!!  Would visit again next time I am in Tally!!!!

name: Cuban Grill
address: 2743 Capital Cir NE, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: This is one of my favorite places to eat either lunch or dinner. I enjoy the Black Bean soup, adding just a little rice and onions. The owners always seem happy to see me and make me feel welcome. If you want a great meal or just a bowl of Black Bean soup, this is a great place to eat! Fast service, but not a fast food place.
awesome place. didnt catch the guys name but super nice. lechon asado was delicious. will be back for coffee and key lime pie.
Definitely best place in Tallahassee for cuban food. Freshly made, awesome yuca, plantains, black beans and rice. Small food joint but really really good Cuban food.
This place was super low key, but had the ambiance of your best friends home. The art work the hung was superb and the food was amazing. Definitely filled the soul. I’m very happy I found it.
A little taste from home in Tallahassee. The owner Carlos & his chef are a delight.

name: The Crum Box Gastgarden
address: 602 Industrial Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32310, USA
reviews: Killer little place!  Amazing sausage sandwich!  I washed it down with a cold beer and all was perfect.  It's a cool little stop for a bite whether your just looking to eat or you're touring the city.  Pete, the owner, made our meal himself and was incredibly hospitable and welcoming.  The Crum Box Gastgarden will be a stop for me every time I'm in Tallahassee.

I really enjoyed the food here! It was very good! This is a family friendly restaurant, it has nice seating outside where you can see a band play! I got a grilled cheese sandwich with a side of Mac and cheese, there was not a very big menu so if you are looking for a large menu of foods I would not recommend, The guy who works here is very nice and your food is out within 15-20 min. I hope you enjoy!

Crum Box is just so delicious. Pete, the owner, is always friendly and his meat can't be beat. Best meatball sub in town, hands down. The sausage makes me happy. And even his vegetarian options bring joy.

This is where to go to have one of tbe best meatball sandwiches ever. The Crum Box Gastgarden has a very laid back and inviting environment. Pete the owner is the coolest guy you can ever meet and treats you like family upon entering. Everyone needs to try the Crum Box out, you wont be disappointed. ✌🏾
Pete is awesome and the food great! We were just passing through town and stopped there. Highly recommended.

name: Riccardo's Restaurant
address: 1950 Thomasville Rd Suite G, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Nice place, friendly staff, good food. Went for lunch. the lasagna was made fresh that morning which is always good to hear. I feel like the red sauce was a little over reduced. It was salty and very strong which is great I'm missing cases but it overpowered the other flavors in the lasagna. We'll definitely go again to try their schnitzel.
Very good! The white clam sauce was amazing... the bread is out of this world... felt a touch slow, but full house at lunch so not an issue...

Nice place in a business complex, not too big, booths and tables available. Lunch deals for like $10, entrees around like $12, good place tasty food casual atmosphere, water tasted a little weird though. Everything my group ate there was great, pizza lasagna eggplant parmesan garlic bread salad yum

Absolutely amazing. The restaurant was nice and dark inside. Quiet. Winderdul place for a date night or night of company. Food was absolutely amazing. We had both pizza and pasta. Both were wonderful. Server was wonderful. I would definitely go back in a heartbeat. Keep up the amazing work.

Love, love, love Riccardo’s food. We visit weekly & are never disappointed with the food. The prices are reasonable & the portions are big ! I recommend the calzones, pizza, spaghetti & meatballs, & lasagna, baked tortellini, meatball sub & the veggie sandwich The dinner roll (served only @ night ) is to die for !!

name: Tour of Italy
address: 3813 N Monroe St #21, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Passing through town on a road trip, I wanted a pasta dinner. This is a small restaurant with a large group enjoying their meal, but my server came fast. I asked if the Italian sausage was sweet or hot, and since he wasn't sure, he offered to ask the chef. The chef prepared some for me to try so I could decide whether to order the Fettuccine Alfredo with the sausage or chicken. The sausage was great with the pasta, as were the rolls with Parmesan cheese topping and salad. I'd go back often if I lived in the area.

Delicious fresh Italian food. Make reservations as it get busy. The pizza was so good. They have outdoor and indoor seating. The heaters in the patio were great for a chilly night. Service was wonderful, the staff was very pleasant

Stopped here based on Google reviews while traveling from the Gulf Coast to Georgia.

The review was spot on. It is a small family run place with all the classic dishes you love and crave.

I had the baked meat lovers spaghetti, which was huge and delicious. One of our kids had the baby pizza and it was big enough to be filling with a great crispy crust.

Their meat sauce is unbelievably good and so it their house dressing. I wish there was a place like this where I live.

Service was amazing.
. We called in advance and they were ready with the food. Taste was great. My family and I had a good time.

A hidden gem. Very unassuming front in a strip mall. Inside however is a quaint little Italian atmosphere with OUTSTANDING food! The garlic rolls really started off the experience as they were excellent. Everyone enjoyed their meals and the desserts were scrumptious.

name: Nefetari's
address: 812 S Macomb St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Great atmosphere. Been here twice, once for painting with a twist and lastly as a vendor for Black on Black Rhyme.  The difference displays of African artifacts adds an aesthetic touch to their welcome.
Great vegan sampler experience. I wish they would do more pop up meals! I miss the great food and the elegant/comfortable atmosphere.
I liked the mutton and chicken curry there. The place is great. I tried their burrito and nachos as well which were not great. They have a good samosa. The interior is thoughtfully designed.
I love the ambience and atmosphere. Very friendly and hospitable!

The decor was definitely interesting, electic Egyptian. Don't be fooled, the food was not Egyptian, very international, and very good! We tried the naan nachos, forbidden fried rice, honey eggplant, mushroom ravioli, and a salad. The nachos was outstanding, never had anything like it.

name: IL Lusso
address: 201 E Park Ave #100, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Our new #1 go to for fine dining in Tallahassee. This place is posh and so good! The location is great! Perfect for special occasions and date nights for those that want to impress. ;-) The staff is very professional and knowledgeable. It's a must for the next time you have some spending money and want great food in a fancy environment.

Il Lusso is an excellent dining experience. We've been three times now, and each time we've had one of the most excellent customer service experiences in Tallahassee. A bit on the expensive side, we normally each get half orders of the pasta and then split a steak. Make sure to make a reservation! It can be hard to get a seat. This restaurant is popular with University fundraisers and legislative folks.

Good atmosphere, great service. Table was small, felt cramped. Food was wonderful. Longer than expected for entre arrival. A good 10-12 minutes after salad was removed from table.

Overall very pleased. Great meal.

The food was to die for! You will not be disappointed! Our servers were Louis and Chuck who both gave excellent customer service! Louis was very knowledgable of the entire menu and answered each and every question with specifics! A great way to celebrate my 50th with friends!

After hearing about this place all day, we were excited to experience the “best restaurant in Tallahassee.” Unfortunately, our experience was not along those lines. Our reservation for for a kitchen view table, but the window to the kitchen was in no way a kitchen view. Our head waiter treated the assistant waiter terribly, snapping his fingers and making noises to get her attention. The som broke the cork in our bottle of wine, took the bottle to the back and returned with the open bottle, no cork and poured a tasting that had cork in the wine. We filled our wine glasses ourselves the rest of the night even while then waiter and som cleared our plates with empty glasses. The food was decent, but not consistent with the prices being charged. Just a weird experience for a restaurant billed as #1 in the city. Would not return again.

name: Z Bardhi's Italian Cuisine
address: 3596 Kinhega Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32312, USA
reviews: Good food. Nice servers. Al fresco atmosphere inviting. Music should be more classic and appropriate to their clientele. There's enough rock and pop other places. Classic guitar or light classical music is more fitting.
One of the best in Tallahassee.  Very good italian food with super nice staff in a countryside setting, although they have a very nice indoor seating area.

Oh my goodness gracious! Outstanding restaurant I wish I had discovered sooner. Cannot wait to return for their new weekend brunch and to dine al fresco under the Jasmine covered pergola. Talented chef and top notch server made my aunt's 93rd birthday celebration beyond special.

Really excellent Italian food and wine.  The specials are worth exploring...I have never come away thinking this or that could be better.  It's great food in a quiet and personal atmosphere.  We do all our special occasions here.

Yummy food and very nice service. The outdoor seating was lovely because the weather was nice. Inside could use an update, and the bathrooms can definitely use a cost of paint / refresh.
Don't be fooled by the log cabin aesthetic. This is fine dining!

name: Kebabas Mediterranean Grill
address: 601 W Gaines St, Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews: This place is amazing!! We had the Holy Cow and Under the Sea platters.. and WOW!! Everything was hot and fresh and so flavorful! Father and son who work their are super nice and caring. Will definitely return very soon!

The Price is reasonable, all the meat is very well seasoned. About 7 minute wait. I came late, so they sold out of salad and lamb, I must try them next time.
A few weeks later I tried shimp, lamb, and the salad. Everything is delicious 😋

Although it’s a food truck, that takes nothing away from this chefs cooking ability. I’ll usually get the chicken kebabs and the quality along with the seasoning on the chicken is second to none. Made fresh with your choice of a side, the portions as well as the taste and even the price has me thankful this place is so close to my house.
this dude is the man, khalid is great and his food is even better. I go three times a week and it’s not enough!
Love it, there service 3 great

name: Osaka Japanese Steak House
address: 1489 Maclay Commerce Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32312, USA
reviews: Exquisitely delicious! Classic authentic Japanese cuisine with original and wonderfully delicious choices throughout the menu.
I love their new location, the food is good as always. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend it.
Osaka has moved to a new location - brand new building! We had sushi. I asked for the sushi chef to make me something unique. He did! Our experience was very pleasurable and tasty.
We got takeout from this location for the first time tonight and it was amazing!  Rock n’ Roll is the way to go!  I would definitely recommend checking them out.

Fun atmosphere with good food.
The wait time to be seated was not long.  The service was good and so was the food.

name: Little Italy
address: 111 S Magnolia Dr #17, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: A true gem in Tallahassee local dining. Fresh and authentic meals that are delicious and reasonably priced. The service we received was outstanding! Oh, and the outdoor cafe seating is adorable and a welcomed option.
I love the atmosphere here!  The food was very good and we will definitely be back!

This place is awesome! The service is amazing. I had the fried calamari and honestly it’s the best calamari I’ve had in a long time. Very light and crisp, not greasy and rubbery like some other places. Come here if you like Italian!
The food was delicious. I had the shrimp parmesan!! The service was the best I'd had during my stay in Tallahassee and I'm looking forward to visiting again!
It is great to see coming back after 30 years that this restaurant still serves great food. Special for the day Ravioli and Spinach Lasagna.

name: MISSION BBQ
address: 216 S Magnolia Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: This place has a nice atmosphere and it very laid back feeling to it. It is basically self serve, you order at a register and get a cup. They prepare your plates and you come and get them from the counter as well as seating yourself. We did have a waitress check on us while we ate, but I think it was more of a wellness check than anything. Everyone was nice and the food was great. Definitely would recommend.

Great place! Got the pulled pork, baked beans, and fries. Amazing flavor of the pork and the house made fries were a very nice touch. Topped off the meal with an ice cold grape Ne-Hi from their vintage bottle ice chest. Staff was very friendly and helped me decide what to eat. Overall great experience! Also loved all the service patches from all over.

Fantastic!  I had never been to Mission BBQ before but there was one across the parking lot from the hotel I was staying in.  My wife and I went there for supper.  It was very good!  We were initially greeted by the awesome decor of the place.  Very patriotic and nostalgic!  I spent ten minutes just looking at photos that were hanging on the walls. Then we ordered our meal. We split a three-meat sampler.  We got the brisket, pulled pork, and cheese jalapeno sausage.  Sides were mac-n-cheese and bacon green beans.  Everything was perfect!  The pulled pork was juicy, brisket rub was great and the sausage was addictive!  To top off a great meal, the friendliness of the employees was very welcoming!  The sent us off with a free pen and beer koozie.  What a great meal and experience!  We'll be back!

On this day I had a pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw. It was very good, my side was the Mac and Cheese. IMHO the Mac and Cheese is the best. The atmosphere is geared towards Military and First Responders.  The interior is decorated in Military and First Responder gear and pictures. It s great place to eat.

Solid four something quasi-commercial BBQ.

Somehow ended up with the kids meal rib deal and a beer Lol but Loved it.  Awesome.  All the flavors were really very good and the portions are fair enough.

I'm from the land of 4 Rivers and while I know there's one in Tally, I'm always looking over the fence for good barbecue somewhere else.  Sides were spectacular.  Sauces, mnmmm... but sauces are subjective.  As with the brisket, which was nice and moist but more like pot roast and fattier than should be for me.  Well portioned (as far as brisket goes) and delicious after saucing up but I prefer smoked brisket so that's off the menu for me.

Definitely solid repeatable barbecue.

name: Korean BBQ & More
address: 2624 W Tennessee St, Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews: Fun place for Korean BBQ, basically you cook your own meat. They also offer all-you-can-eat sushi, and a salad bar. Service is always friendly. It's a great place for a date night, or just hanging out with friends. I like to take my kids here so they can make ME dinner, it's always family fun. However it's borderline kid friendly.
For $20, we got huge portions of really good food. The rice medley and beef are both amazing. I'll definitely be a frequent customer.
Best Korean BBQ in town. Did a tour in South Korea and can say. That there's is authentic.

This was our first time trying the Korean BBQ spot, and it will definitely be a regular stop for us. 

Food was great, the waitress walked us through the menu and was kind enough to explain everything clearly and simply. Rice medley is definitely the move, we also got the beef which was awesome.  

You get some serious bang for your buck, unlimited tea and coffee, soups, and side salads with every meal. 

Not a spot you want to kick back in for a long time, but for a hole in the wall spot it’s pretty killer.
Looks small, but this little gem is priceless. Spectacular food, with many side dishes. Friendly and cozy atmosphere. 10/10, would recommend.

name: Sweet Pea Cafe
address: 832 W Tharpe St, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Made the trip from Albany to try some Vegan eats. Upon entering the place was clean, well lit, and organized. The cashier was somewhat friendly. I grabbed a little of everything off the menu and two of every sweet so I can try it all and it felt as though once my purchase was over 80 bucks the cashier seemed friendlier. Food is pretty good and sweets are even better.

I’m still in the restaurant as I type — it’s amazing. The ambiance is great and the customer service is superb. Please do yourself the favor of having an open mind and an open palette. This meal was such a pleasant surprise — and it’s local. Whoever the owner is: well done. I’ll be back sooner than later.
I don't remember the name of that dish BUT it is rather exotic in presentation and tasty.   This is veggie restaurant.  A local favorite.

A local favorite. I must have been at least a dozen times. Quick service, reasonable prices, and a solid menu. They have expanded it over time as certain specials have become staple menu options. Hard to beat the Tempeh Reuben but the buffalo tofu sandwich and burger are close seconds. They also source locally, organically, and fair trade, not to mention they recycle and compost. This place is a gem.

Pictured is a special they had: Texas Burger with onion rings.

There isn’t anything on this menu I wouldn’t recommend. Well thought out and delicious dishes. 
We ordered the Big Salad, the Biscuits and Gravy, coffee and a Cinnamon Bun. The portions are large and very satisfying. Every time I visit Tallahassee, I make this a must stop! 
Little to no waste as well :)

name: The Egg Cafe & Eatery
address: 3740 Austin Davis Ave, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: This place was really good and the pricing wasn’t horrible. We stopped here on a road trip for breakfast. I got a buffalo chicken tender sandwich (I know it’s a weird choice for breakfast but it sounded good) and it was only 9.99. It also came with breakfast potatoes. The meal was filling and tasty. Two people in my party got omelets, one person got a “trainers breakfast” which consisted of seasoned egg whites and fruit, and one person got a salmon BLT wrap. She said the BLT was delicious and she highly recommends it. The service was pretty good and the waiter was fast to get drink refills and whatever else we needed. The atmosphere is pretty cool and modern. Overall, it’s a fun, clean place with a great variety of food for everyone.

Great brunch experience!  It was my first time going to The Egg and I enjoyed myself. The food was delicious, prompt friendly service and they had a beautiful venue space. 

Food ordered:
The Ultimate Seafood Omelette
Cinnamon Roll French Toast 

This is a nice place for Breakfast, Brunch, or Lunch with things to choose from that will not be disappointed. Give them a try and stop by!!!

My spouse and I ate brunch on a Sunday and both had a difficult time choosing our meal because there were so many dishes that looked great. We decided on The Yellow Bird and a quiche with shrimp and both were delicious. Like next level delicious. Our server, Cody, was very attentive and refilled our coffee frequently. Highly recommended for breakfast!

We had a great experience on a Sunday morning. My boyfriend wanted a mimosa, so we went here! They have a very expansive menu so it took a while to order but our waitress was patient and answered all of our questions. They have plenty of options as well as specials, which were different quiches that day. We both got potato skillets which were good. The chicken that was in my boyfriends was unseasoned though, which would have been a total downer if he didn't have bacon in it as well. The only other downside was that after paying we didn't see anyone for a long time so it took forever to get a to-go cup. We will be back though for sure!
The pics were beautiful but the food unfortunately didn't have really any taste. We were all unsatisfied leaving. Just not for us. Staff was friendly, food just not tasting great.

name: LongHorn Steakhouse
address: 2400 N Monroe St, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews:
Great restaurant for a date night or a special celebration. We came here for our early Valentine's Day dinner and they did not disappoint! The food was great, the service was good and the environment was wonderful. On our grading scale of 1-10:
Appetizer Wings 8
Ribeye steak 9
Liquor/Bar 10
Lobster 7
Salmon 9
Veggies/sides 10
Restroom 9
Come here for a great time with friends and family!

I went here four times, three of times were miserable experiences, the most recent time was better because I had a good waiter. He was very friendly, constantly refilled my soda and gave me one to go, and made himself known with the usual customers. Based on him alone this place would get 5 stars but other factors will make me avoid this place in the future. 

The last time I guessed other waiter sat a family in a location were supposed to have a large group, so to fit this group of 20 they moved this small family's table inches from my booth. The father and young son were fine, the other individual was rude, cursing, and took his shoes off in front of me eating. And he used my table as his own storage place, he kept placing menus, dropped utensils, and his stuff on my table where my food was. A waitress saw this and removed the menus but didn't address anything else. 

Previous times I got periods of no service. For one lunch it took them almost an hour to bring my food and never refilled my friend, then after that long wait keep pestering me if I wanted the check, rushing me to go after I waited so long for food, they didn't even bring bread. 

Worst was the time I ordered salad for lunch, that brought my bread then no salad or refills for 50 mins, I kept asking but my waitress was not around. At the hour mark after ordering my salad and it didn't show up I got up and left for the buffet across the street.
Appetizers are good. Steak is awesome but felt little hard hard on the rib eye.. Good Service and will be back.

I placed an online order for food at 4:15pm. I am pregnant and my 6-year-old was sick at home, so I wanted to pick up something tasty on my drive home from work. Online, it said that my order would be ready in 30 minutes. I arrived around 4:35pm and they said it would be a few minutes. A long line formed at the take out counter and no one seemed to be looking to see whether my food was ready or not. I got back in line and checked in again around 5:00. They said my food was not ready yet. At about 5:20pm, they told me that my food was coming out. Waited in line again in order to pick it up, but I was missing bread, butter, dipping sauce for the appetizer, my soup for my dinner, a drink, and the ice cream was half melted. The take out person went and gathered everything that was missing and even switched out the ice cream for me. Then, told me that they are out of bread (which I ordered with my order at 4:15 online) and that I could wait for bread. At 5:35, I finally had all my food. Also, there was no comfortable place to sit (I am pregnant) to wait. My choices were a bench with no back or a high stool with a small seat. I cannot believe that my food took over an hour to make. I will not be coming back to this Longhorn.

LongHorn Steakhouse provides a quality dining experience.  The menu offerings do not end with just excellent steaks.  There are many delicious options for side items.  Additionally, it would be worthwhile to check for any seasonal specials throughout the year.  These selections - also - are quite appealing. 

Ralph Hadley

name: Tan's Asian Cafe
address: 2743 Capital Cir NE #110, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: Door service was awesome. My husband and I had no where to eat while in Tallahassee yesterday except our truck. We saw Tan's and ordered at the door, where menus were provided. Only waited 10 minutes for our order. Customer service was excellent. Asked if we could sit at one of their outside tables to eat. Was told, "Yes, and if you need anything, please let me know!"  (Great lunch portion sizes too!) My meal was good but my husband wasn't as happy with his, but we had no idea what we were ordering!  That's why only  4 Star. We will definitely go back here, kindness goes a long way for us! BTW, thank you for being kind to us, for providing us and providing menus to your customers. We can tell you care!  Barbie

I work right by this place, so I stop here for lunch pretty often. The food is fresh, it is well flavored. The Thai soup is amazing! the Mongolian tofu is the best tofu you will ever eat! I highly recommend this place, and it doesn’t have MSG like a lot of other Chinese restaurants. (No MSG bloat) It is more towards the Thai flavoring with being run by Indonesians. Try it out!

Staff exceptionally friendly. Food was outstanding. Small buffet but huge selection. Wide variety. Got take out a few times and thought it was great so we tried the buffet. By far the best buffet in town hands down. Spicy sections actually had some heat to them. A few things I've never had before and some old favorites. Great spring rolls and egg rolls. Certainly our new favorite  Lunch spot.

We've all been to dozens, or more, Chinese buffets. You come to accept the averagness of food. Welcome to Tans, a fresh, not frozen, deluxe buffet! This joint even has some homemade curries that are amazing. The salt and pepper shrimp, yes this is on buffet, are huge, fresh and delicious. Skip all the rest and eat at the best!

I loved the food here! 
I decided to try some items off their Indonesian menu just because I have never tried Indonesian before. I had the Beef in coconut milk with Balinese sauce and it was so good. Normally, I would take home left overs but I overstuffed myself on the food. I also had a stuffed Tofu appetizer. That was also pretty good. I liked the contrast in texture. You had this super crispy outside with the Tofu inside, which is creamy then the vegetables in the middle. The sauce just rounded it out as well. The spice level was very chill and just brought flavor to the dish as opposed to heat, which is always appreciated when I am trying something for the first.
Price was very reasonable for quantity and quality received as well.
Highly recommended!!

name: Red Snapper
address: 5023 Crawfordville Rd # 5, Tallahassee, FL 32305, USA
reviews: Legit Vietnamese food and delicious southern food as well. Interesting combination. The owner is awesome and the chef is great. We're Vietnamese and have been eating Vietnamese food all our lives--we know what's good. We had the seafood combo and the Vietnamese rice dish. Both were really tasty. We'll be back!

Whenever we fly into Tallahassee, this tends to be the first stop after the airport since we live in a landlocked state and want GOOD seafood. The range and selection of seafood -- both Southern and Vietnamese -- is outstanding. The fried okra is the best I have ever had. The manager and staff are attentive. The facility is always clean, casual, and timely for a quick lunch or stop on the way back to the airport.

The Red Snapper is as good as the reviews said . Fresh tasty food and friendly service.They have a huge menu with all the seafood you could want and tons of Asian  inspired dishes, I am pretty sure it is mostly  vietnamese, my wife really enjoyed the Pho. 
    We did get the garlic shrimp to go one time and by the time we got it home it was just so so. Basically  I recommend eating in for best taste.

A Tallahassee gem. The food is amazing and the service is fantastic. The food offered is either Vietnamese or Seafood. I have been here several times and have never had a bad experience. The owners are a couple - the wife does the cooking and the husband mans the front (taking orders, serving food, buses tables, etc.). I always enjoy the small talk I have with the husband because he's super friendly.

If you need a recommendation on what to try for the Vietnamese food, I HIGHLY recommend their beef stew - it's out of this world. There's just so much flavor packed into it and it smells divine. 
I'm also not from the South, but shrimp and grits have become a new favorite classic Southern dish. If you get some here, they drizzle it with this garlic butter sauce that makes my mouth water just thinking about it.

I'm conflicted with spreading the word about this restaurant because I enjoy it being my little secret, but I want them to stay in business because I just adore this place so much. Anyway, just try the food here - you will not be disappointed.
Delicious food, excellent service, loyal client base. You're missing out if you don't at least try it. Also, the best pho in town.

name: Mimi's Table
address: 1311 Miccosukee Rd, Tallahassee, FL 32308, USA
reviews: I wish I was able to give Mimi’s Table a higher rating than 5/5. Our food was delicious and perfectly cooked, and the service was fantastic. I highly recommend the shrimp + grits, crab cakes, Tuscan chicken, and  brownie sundae dessert. As a self-professed foodie, I have higher than normal standards for food, but Mimi’s Table hit every expectation out of the park. Fine dining at it’s finest.

We ordered Mimi's Table Family Dinner for Easter dinner 2020 to go. Everything was delicious and was a real bright spot during such a difficult time.  We had the braised short ribs, but I think everyone's favorite part was the bread!!  I'm so glad we were able to support a local business and a fantastic one at that.  I'm definitely scheduling a date night here when restaurants open up again!
Intimate French inspired Southern cooking at its best.

My daughter and I were graciously welcomed soon after the restaurant was opened. It was barely four thirty but we had to celebrate an event in our lives and we were treated royally as we sat at the bar drinking wine and nibbling on specially prepared goodies. From then on it has been our "special place". We love it there.

What a nice pretty new spot. Hubbie loved the braised short ribs and I loved the healthy seafood grille. My friends was disappointed in the Tucson chicken as it was all dark meat.  The cheese board was yummy.
We all enjoyed the homemade French apple tart.
