name: VeneBites
address: 217 E 3rd Ave, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: WOW! Came in on opening day and was immediately greeted with kindness and warmth. The service was prompt and the food was DELICIOUS! I was very excited to try Venebites as soon as I heard they opened today. Come and give them a try and get some delicious food! I tried a number of things (and it took everything out of me not to overdo it). Wishing them lots of luck and I'm happy to have them in my neighborhood!!!
Delicious food. Well priced. This is my second time eating here this week.

My daughter ordered empanadas.  They didn't have them on the menu.  But, the chef prepared 4 for her anyway.  they were awesome.  That is real customer service.  Friendly and willing to do whatever to satisfy a customer.
This restaurant just surpassed all Tallahassian eateries I've been to. It's bound to become very popular. Outstanding price, portion, and TASTE. Wow. Thank you for opening.

Absolutely great Venezuelan food with very friendly pricing and staff. A few places in town have tried to make arepas but for the most part fall short and don't feel authentic. VeneBites is quite the opposite: real arepas made with passion and flavorful fillings that are to die for. Their other small bite offerings are also worth checking out. Do make sure to come early because they tend to sell out before closing time.

name: Isabella's Pizzeria Napoletana
address: 799 W Gaines St #101, Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews:
Pretty cool spot in College Town.  Nice space.  Good atmosphere.  Saw they have a really good assortment of beers, bottles, and craft draft too.  All good things.

Otherwise, underwhelming given all the reviews, pictures, and price point.  Just wasn't feeling it.  Maybe it was the traffic or the hassle of finding metered parking or general awkwardness of the front of house, I don't know.  

Arugula salad was nice enough but the Rustica pizza wasn't special like we thought it'd be.  Disappointing really, given the hype, that it came out under done, shy of basil, and with unappealing eggplant.  Seemed par cooked and heated up after the toppings went on just to warm things up.  Wasn't like you'd think it'd be coming out of that hot oven.  ...after digging through some other reviews, I see this comes up with them.  Probably should have ordered it "extra done" or "medium well" with an extra five seconds cook time, like another reviewer tipped.  

Definitely A-OK but whatever's special about them was lost on me.
My new favorite Tallahassee pizza place.  For good reason. Great quality ingredients and good service. Love the brick oven and the incredible crust.

Very good Italian restaurant were you can enjoy a delicious Italian pizza (said by an Italian). The service was good and fast. You have different options, you can choose the pizzas from the menu or you can customize your own pizza. Everything was good, also the cheesecake, the only problem was that there was a little bit of must on the cheese (I said it to the waiter).
Very fresh and delicious. Everything handmade. Nice variety of salads. Try the lemon vinaigrette dressing. We split a pizza and added salads for a delicious lunch!

Okay, so I have to admit. I just had wine there. But their wood burning oven (for pizza) is very cool. This restaurant is extremely close to FSU in CollegeTown. Their pizza SMELLED good. Wine was tasty.

name: Chuy's
address: 904 E Lafayette St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. The food was great but very spicy. I'm not a spicy person so I didn't too much care for it but the food was good. I also think the fajita plate for 2 is not for 2 because the food amount was very small portion. That was my only concern.
Scrumptious food and drinks.  Love the atmosphere.  Next time I will be bringing a framed picture of my dogs and hope they get added to their walls.  We will definitely be back.
5 stars 4 months. Today food good but server is less than adequate.
Food was good. Service from Ashley was great a great server and our hostess was very helpful. . Thank you for being so accommodating to our group.

Chuy's has become one of my favorite places to go lately for all of my brunch meetings! It's so old school eclectic.. The inside full of thoughtfully put together antique decor and the outside this glorious display of various beautiful flowers... Now.. This food... All I know is it is OUTSTANDING, and especially this ranch jalapeno tasting dip they give you along with fresh made salsa and seemingly never ending warm chips.. Trust me... You'll love it here.. Wonderful atmosphere and wonderful customer service ❤ I'll be back soon Chuy's! 😏

name: San Miguel Mexican Restaurant
address: 200 W Tharpe St, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: These people are open for take out during the quarantine. I just got the hook up on some chicken nachos supreme. Highly recommend!

The food came out hot and looked really good. The food was a little bland for my taste.I was trying something new so it might just be me. My server was very nice and attentive. The atmosphere was very quiet I was expecting to hear some music, and I did when I went to the bathroom. The place was clean, and the staff was very friendly. I will be returning on a Saturday and and stick with what I know.
With amazing staff and consistently great food, San Miguels quickly became my favorite restaurant in town. Not only is my stomach full when I leave, my heart is too. Love you guys!

First time customer today, and even with a large to-go order to take back to the house to Taco tuesday/Cinco De Mayo at  home, quarantine style, everything was really good. Fresh food, great flavors, friendly service. I will definitely be back and recommend to give a try if you haven't already.

Authentic Mexican restaurant. The food consistently taste great! Servers are nice. Owner is always there and talks to customers! One of the best places to eat if you are looking for some margaritas, tequila cocktails and great Mexican food. Plenty parking with easy in and out. Prices are great also. There is also plenty outside seating all in the shade. Food comes out pretty quick after the order.

name: Siam Sushi
address: 1700 N Monroe St #9, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: The seared tuna salad is off the charts amazing, they give you a great amount of tuna and its packed with alvacado. The ingredients are always fresh, and they are consistent with the quality. Also, they do rainbow rolls! I haven't found any other place in Tallahassee that does rainbow rolls so I was ecstatic to find out this lovely place makes them. They are delicious too, the fish is always fresh. If you haven't tried them out, you HAVE TO!
Sashimi was so fresh! And they give you a really nice size of meat. Our 'Peter' had the perfect amount of heat and was HUGE. Nice wine choice. Will definitely be back!
Best sushi in Tallahassee!  Great service, nice ambiance, reasonably priced.... worth it!

***EDIT (2/21/2020) - They must have gotten a new sushi chef for lunch that isn't on top of the menu yet. Something I have gotten many times (Tuna Tartar) that's be consistent and delicious was completely botched and disappointing today. Too bad considering this place is my favorite in town.  

Original Review - One of the best sushi places we've been in town. They were a little short staffed when we went, so things took a while but the servers were relatively attentive. Great place. We will definitely be back. Try the trust me roll! That chef knows what they are doing!

Making great sushi is here. For myself, eating great sushi is an adventure. A creative sushi chef is always exploring new ways to combine flavors, colors and textures, while at the same time respecting the respecting the ancient traditions of sushi making. Siam Sushi is very good restaurant. They have  freshest fish, veggies, seasonings and toppings on their dishes.

name: The Bark
address: 507 All Saints St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Loved The Bark! Food was great and service was quick and friendly. Parking is out back and on side street. You order at the counter and you can pick some games from the corner to play while you wait for your food to be brought to you. There's bins you put your dishes in when your done. There is outdoor seating and you they have free pool to play as well. No kid menu but my daughter enjoyed the herb roasted potatoes( home-fries) and watermelon. Would highly recommend to anyone!

Vegetarian restaurant with vegan and gluten free options. Very tasty, flavorful menu choices with daily specials. Casual atmosphere. Friendly, pleasant service. Order at the counter, eat inside or out. Formerly Bread and Roses Kitchen (when located around the corner on RR street). Really good food. Actual drinking glasses and utensils (not disposables) add to the pleasure!
The staff and food here is always above average and have never let me down. I know coming BARK will leave me full and satisfied. Highly recommend.

The atmosphere here is incredible, the decor is fun, and the staff are super nice. I went for karaoke night and had a blast! Everybody gets a chance to sing, even if they show up a bit later. Definitely have to try the peanut butter pie if you get the chance!

We had been hearing about this great local place to try from our local farmers at Handsome Harvest since we're vegan, so we finally got a chance to try it out, loved it! Nice people, great food, fun atmosphere and awesome artwork. We're already looking forward to going back!

name: Tin Lizzy's Cantina
address: 619 S Woodward Ave c103, Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews: Good prices, great staff! Amazing place to watch the super bowl but kinda wish they would make the food a little better. More chicken then bread next time please. Other than that it's a great place to come have some beers and food
This place is phonemmonal, our waitress was attentive and caring. The food was divine, very spacious and comfortable atmosphere.  Will visit again when we return to Tallahassee ❤

I went here for the first time today with a friend. I have wanted tacos for so long, and Tin Lizzy's Cantina fully satisfied my craving! I had the mahi mahi taco, and it tasted so much better than I expected (I don't normally eat fish, but I have been trying new foods recently). I don't like slaw, but whatever their slaw is made from tasted really good. The service was good, and after we had paid, someone who seemed like the owner came up to ask how we had enjoyed the meal, and informed us that on Tuesdays they have tacos for cheaper prices. I will definitely be going back!
Love this place! The food and atmosphere is great, as well as the taco Tuesday deals. The servers are all well trained and friendly and Bailey is super great!

Meh. 

I've been here 3 times now. Each time we had slow service, which is particular annoying because you have to pay to park for each hour. With this bottleneck of time, they should really keep each table in and out under an hour, but this has NEVER happened for me. Which means you run the risk of getting a ticket, or you need to pay for 2 hours. 

As for the food, it is only ever worth it on Taco Tuesdays, otherwise it is a bit pricey, probably just for the sake of being in college town. But as for choices in college town, it's semi-decent. Also, the chicken tortilla soup isn't creamy, which is kinda lame.

name: Dao Restaurant
address: 3425 Bannerman Rd a102, Tallahassee, FL 32312, USA
reviews: We have eaten several times, particularly after church on Sunday, and have been very pleased with the quality of food and service. Since it had been several weeks since we had been back we tried it this past weekend and was surprised that they offered a full buffet plus several Sushi offerings. This is not your normal buffet, the food was fresh, high quality and very tasteful. The Sushi offerings provided about 10-12 different versions. The pricing was incredible . This is one of several restaurants at Bannerman's Crossing, which is quickly becoming a foodies paradise with all the great restaurants.
Great environment and the staff was pleasant. Maria did an excellent job serving. 10-2:30 buffet on Sunday. Very kid friendly. Food was great & fortune cookies.
Amazing sushi. Chef Jose is a true artist. Nice atmosphere. Friendly service. A must try.

We actually ended up at Dao by mistake but I’m so happy with how it worked out. Our waitress was so sweet and helpful. The food is well priced and tasty. Unbeknownst to us we arrived during happy hour so the drinks were on sale too. We’re definitely going back! *get the Sangria!*

This is one of the worst meals Ive ever had bar none.  They should've spent more money on paying for good chefs rather than on their fancy locale.  Word of mouth about a hidden away place is fabulous advertising.

Cant believe ANYONE wrote up a good review about this greasy spoon in disguise! Their taste  must be in their foot!

name: Island Wing Company Tallahassee
address: 1370 Market St, Tallahassee, FL 32312, USA
reviews: We ordered the Hall of Fame Family Pack last night. It clearly states you get a pitcher of Margaritas or a 6-pack of beer with it. We also spoke to friends who ordered this and received the alcohol. Well last night they changed there rules and charged us more $65 and did not give us any choice of alcohol. Do not believe what is posted for the family packs. We will not be going back even though we like the wings.

I recently had my first experience going to Island swing Company and I absolutely loved the atmosphere! My coworkers were throwing a surprise party for my boss and so we reserved one of the fire pit tables out on the patio and there were quite a few of us but there was more than enough room for us all with those long wicker type benches. I ordered a frozen mango margarita and it was definitely in the top 4 best I’ve had! And the serving sizes of their food was enough to share with 3 other people, so you definitely get more than you pay for! I definitely will be returning.

Fantastic food! Wonderful flavors and huge portions! The staff is more than attentive. We have been taken care of by 3 wonderful staff members! Thank you Alli, Whitney and Cameron for making this a great first visit! Won't  be out last! Thanks to Gavin at Mattress Firm for recommending this great place!

Everything was so delicious and the service was excellent. I'm not sure what my friends ordered for a shared plate, but the chicken wings sauce was pretty spicy - utterly delicious! You can tell it's great as it was full of people and all kinds of people were coming through the door. Definitely worth a visit!

First time going there and would definitely go back. Wish there was one of these in Nashville! Love how everything is baked here rather than fried (their main theme). Food was great. Large selection on menu. Our server was pretty informative and allowed us to try our sauces for wings before deciding which flavor. Cameron was really awesome! Clean bathrooms. Would definitely recommend.

name: Spear It
address: 609 W Tennessee St, Tallahassee, FL 32304, USA
reviews: Excellent food and service. Katie, our bartender was awesome. The mac n’ cheese bites were such a good app to share. The chicken wings were very good. The owner/GM Mike came by to check on us. We arrived at happy hour. Great happy hour prices 4-7. We will be back to try the rest of the food which looks so good. Recommend if you're in Tally. (good for old people too).

I ordered the Ma's meat loaf and it did not disappoint! It had a sweet and spicy ketchup sauce on top, then crunchy bacon. So delicious! Huge portions, as well. My husband got the salmon. It was tasty, but needed more seasoning. Will def come back!

Big portions, cool atmosphere, killer food. A little pricey but What more could you want? Try the fried shrimp with that awesome sauce, the Mac and cheese burger, or the meat loaf sandwich. Never disappointed.

Our kids, who go to FSU, recommended this restaurant when we visited with them recently. Although we enjoyed the atmosphere, the food left much to be desired; the service was better than the food, but not much better. we started with an appetizer of cheese fries and although the quantity was very large there was only cheese on the top layer of fries and it did not come with any dipping sauce. After asking for ranch, it took at least 10 to 15 minutes for us to acquire any.  Our waitress was very good about refilling our water,  however. My daughter enjoyed her meal the most...chicken tenders, onion rings and fried Mac and cheese bites. I do NOT recommend the fish and chips, that was the special for tonight. The fish was really soggy and I couldn't eat it. My husband warned everyone not to get the veggie burger. He did not like it at all. My son got the bash burger and really enjoyed it.  The side salad was large, but not very tasty. Although the restaurant looks nice and has a nice atmosphere I would be in no hurry to return.
I had the Renegade Shrimp and a mango margarita. They were both delicious! Our server was also great! Can't remember her name but she has blonde hair. We will definitely return!

name: La Fiesta Mexican Restaurant
address: 2329 Apalachee Pkwy, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: Great employees, clean and comfortable, good prices and a big menu to choose from. The staff members make us feel like we are of the family.
Speedy service. Great food. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

Visiting from GA. A bit of a wait to get a menu. The blonde said she forgot. Our waiter was really nice and helpful. He kept our drinks refilled. Food was good. Nachos come with shredded cheese which is something I'm not used to but my waiter brought me cheese sauce. Overall I would definitely recommend this place. Food came fast and was hot. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because it was a bit of a wait for menus from cashiers. They seemed distracted.
I always get the fajita quesadilla (lunch special usually), and it's my favorite. I eat half & take half for leftovers, and it's such a great deal!
Regular customers and curb side pick up did not disappoint.  Delicious!  I do miss eating in the restaurant though 😔

name: Backwoods Bistro
address: 401 E Tennessee St, Tallahassee, FL 32301, USA
reviews: A really happening place with a good bar and live music. I attended a birthday dinner here and had the tuna appetizer and a steak. The ahi was cooked perfectly! The steak was closer to medium than rare but it was flavorful and a good cut of meat. The servers were polite and attentive. That makes it easy to see why this place is popular with the locals over 30.

Delicious good food. I love this place and it's sister restaurant. Food always fresh and tasty. I try to get the rotating seasonal specials. Also get dessert, I never had a bad dessert from here before. Good selection and nice atmosphere, especially with the live music.

This is hands down my favorite restaurants in Tallahassee. The food is phenomenal and always fresh. The staff are always friendly and I love the environment. I have tried many things on the menu and have never been disappointed. The stuffed fried green tomatoes are superb!!
First time and it was great. Brought some friends from Atlanta here. Black and Bleu Mac !! Awesome. Nick was our waiter ..... Great service. Thanks Nick.

It's hard to choose a dish since the entire menu is full of great dishes. There is a big bar area where you can catch live music or other entertainment. The main dining area is adjacent with two separate sections. Natural elements and local photography decorate the wall in a simple rustic fashion.

name: Crystal River Seafood
address: 2721 N Monroe St #2818, Tallahassee, FL 32303, USA
reviews: Great customer service and very good menu choices, offers special meal combos and all you can eat at reasonable prices. The food was great! Customer service ladies was very was respectful, food preparation was excellent and hot.
Great place to get great seafood. I would have given 5 stars, but they don't have a liquor license. Huge proportions at a very reasonable price. I'll definitely be back, the next time I'm in town.

Great food at a very reasonable price. My Shrimp Alfredo was amazing, and my husband's burger was cooked perfectly and he said it was very good. The atmosphere is very comfortable, and service was great. Emily is a wonderful and attentive server. We will definitely be back and I can't wait to take the kids next time!

Excellent and delicious seafood restaurant! Food was hot and fresh! Tammy gave us great service. Love this place! We always enjoy the flounder and shrimp. Have been going there for years and it is always consistently great, okra and green beans were hot and good!

Ordered a side of fried catfish fingers to-go.
Came with three or four.
Took the four.
Asked for cocktail sauce as a condiment.
They provided plenty.
Fish was good.

Thumbs up to the two young ladies working the front when I arrived.

They were both helpful and friendly.
 
One recognized I was in town for work and let me know that I could get a discount on my order for staying at a local hotel.

Appreciated 🙂

The other young lady asked if I wanted my drink while I waited on my food.

Yes, and once again, grateful 🙂

Tasty fish, good service, quickly prepared, off a main road, prices so-so.

Wish I would have tried this restaurant sooner.
Hope you don’t make the mistake I did. 😉
